Reviews.Title: “"Never again"”
Reviews.Author: Terrirn1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very shabby. Rugs snagged and spotty. The bed was on a metal frame that squeaked awful. The service at the bar was the worst. Girls in tiny black dresses that only waited on you if you were wearing a suit or dripping in diamonds. The Algonquin needs to hurry up and get renovated already!!

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: Nate A
Reviews.Content: This location of this hotel couldn’t have been any better. Then again its NYC so everything is super close compared to where we are from (AZ). I think the staff could have been a bit nicer and helpful and that is the reason why this review received a 4 star and not a 5. This was the first stop on our honeymoon in Nov. 2011. The value was very good since we bid for this hotel on priceline.com!

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Prem K
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel I have stayed. It's really a signature collection. You would notice that right when you enter the hotel. All the graphics were done neatly and presentable inside the room. Of course, all NY hotels have small room size but this one is special.

Reviews.Title: “Missing the Algonquin”
Reviews.Author: RuthSBorland
Reviews.Content: We travel to New York City many times during the year and always stay at the Algonquin. We have found the Algonquin to be our favorite hotel of all others that we have stayed. The lobby is a great extension of your room and you can relax there to have a drink or coffee in the morning. Perhaps the best quality of the hotel is the wonderful staff that always makes you feel at home. The hotel respects history and makes you feel part of the history of New York. We have stayed in other very nice hotels while the hotel is being renovated but none can come close to the Algonquin. Hurry back!

Reviews.Title: “Character rather than cutting edge”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: A weekend in New York at the Algonquin. Wonderfully eccentric, steeped in NYC history, old-fashioned service and values, all refreshing to me but maybe an acquired taste. Incredible location just off Times Square. Rooms tiny, air-con noisy, lifts miniscule, New Yorker cartoon wallpaper wonderful, great cocktails just a collage of fascinating people in the lounge and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “NYC for New Years! Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: jasonf1975
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC for new years. Had a blast. The hotel was very nice and the lobby area was beautifully decorated but.. Small rooms (okay it is time square) and the elevator took Forever! The hotel was being closed for renevations the day we checked so. I would deff try them again and look forward to staying after the renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Hotel Directly!”
Reviews.Author: louise h
Reviews.Content: Booked a package with their package service and it was a complete disaster. My transportation was overpriced (ask the hotel to book it directly), The lady who"helped" me was from new york guest and was so rude. they were charging a ticket delivery fee that was like $100.00 on top of the ticket price and i said, forget it ill just get them from your office. She was so rude about it and said that I couldnt do that.Her name was kelly kat something or other. I asked why booking a package was saving me money when i could have booked everything separately and she said it was"the service"It was just awful, the tickets were late and not even the right seating locations. I should have known after talking with kelly, she was a nightmare. Just save yourself money and problems by booking on your own. My husband and I were so mad but were pleased with the hotel itself

Reviews.Title: “A piece of NY history”
Reviews.Author: JessOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: The Algonquin is a funny place, there is a tremendous amount of history here, evident by the traditional furnishings in the lobby. There is custom wall paper in the hallways of New Yorker cartoons featuring The Algonquin. The bar is swanky and fun - the kind of place you wouldn't be surprised to see a celebrity or politician in the corner (not that we did). The gin and tonics met the higher end of NY pricing, but they were strong and welcomed on a hot summer day. The lobby/lounge was to feature an evening of song by noted (rising?) opera singers, which we missed because we had plans - but I bet it was great! I was surprised (even though I shouldn't have been) at the number of languages spoken by the staff - this is an accommodating group. The bellmen allowed us to borrow an umbrella, which was very nice. The odd part of the hotel is the rooms - they have a more modern feeling to them. The furnishings feel out of place, and too 'young', like if you let your 13 year old daughter decorate a room in her grandmother's house. But, hey - you don't go to NYC to stay in your room, so I say, "who cares?" The plumbing is antiquated. Easy walk from Grand Central, not too bad to get to the theatre district. Even if you don't stay here - it's worth stopping in!

Reviews.Title: “old old old”
Reviews.Author: ManiBagga
Reviews.Content: very old. Everything seemed old. rooms are tiny. And did i say old. clean but old. no problems with service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Algonquin Landmark”
Reviews.Author: Neduardo
Reviews.Content: I love NYC & I love History....put these two together and you get The Algonquin! The Algonquin is rich in history, Style & class. The location is great. Close to Broadway. The only NYC Location I know of where you can enjoy a 5 star dinner and take in a fabulous show at the same time! The decor is classic and some of the rooms hardware & bath styles are classic which make the stay nastalgic. If you go ou must try the signature "Algonquin" Cocktail made famous by the the round table in 1920's . If you find the review helpful let us know!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RPCV8688
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's true the rooms are small, but this hotel is full of history and charm. Beware of the drink prices; ask for a drink menu so you'll know what you're getting into ($20 per cocktail). It's worth it to have one drink in the lobby, take in the decor, and do some people-watching. The bed was very comfortable, with nice linens. The location is great if you're going to the theatre, and it's also easy to walk to Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “It's usually better than this...”
Reviews.Author: lanis53
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel of choice for me when I stay in NYC. It has such rich history and such wonderful character but on my most recent stay there [12/8 - 12/11], I must say that they failed miserably especially given the price - around $600/night with all fees/taxes/services charges tacked on. The doormen were rude; bellhops absent; seating in their renowned restaurant and bar pitiful. I will have to take a second thought when I go back in February. They are planning on closing down for renovations for a very short time after the Holidays and it appears that they've already shutdown with their service. I was extremely disappointed.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Folly Beach, South Carolina, United States
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Krista K
Reviews.Content: This hotel gas some of the most helpful and courteous employees in NYC. The building is full of historic charm. The restaurant is very good, especially the weekend brunch. The standard room has only a queen bed, pretty small, but elegant. Nice window seat, upscale amenities. The best location you could have for theatre, shopping, nightlife, a short 2 blocks to Times Square. I would absolutely go there again,

Reviews.Title: “Algonquin yes and no”
Reviews.Author: JohnKMiamiLakes
Reviews.Content: The Algonquin is very well situated in the city - very close to many areas by walking and subways are nearby. The lobby is very pleasing and this area may be used for drinks (although $21 for a martini is a bit high), light snacks, or just people watching. We ate at the round table for dinner one evening and the food was good and the service was excellent. In fact, the entire staff is excellent. Do not get a room that overlooks the street; it is very, very noisy. Avoid at all costs room 212. Trash pickup is between 4 am and 4:30 am, and it is loud. In fact, the noise level from the street is almost constant. The answer, "Well, this is New York" doesn't seem to make it any better, but that is the response if you mention the noise. The literary history of the hotel is interesting, and one can imagine Dorothy Parker sitting at the round table holding court. That is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: onaplaneagain
Reviews.Content: I was at the Algonquin Hotel for two nights. It is a Marriott property so you will get points for the stay. The location is great, a block from Times Square and other mid town attractions and all the great restaurants. I found out as I was taken to my room that this was the oldest hotel in New York City. It was a pleasure to be in something not routine to the big box hotels I normally stay. Like everything in NY it is n to cheap. I only was in my room to sleep, the rooms are small and I had a room on the 12th floor which was quiet for a LOUD city. Even if you don't stay here you should at least step into the lobby or bar and check it out. You really feel like traveling back in time 109 years.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: suluu
Reviews.Content: My husband, little dog, and I had a great time at this hotel. We stayed for five nights using our airline miles, which was awesome because the room rate was costly. I researched that they have a "pet program" and inquired about this when we got to our room. They were a bit puzzled, but then brought for Benny (our dog) a tiny pet bed (was funny), paper towels, and pet bowl. Was a small, but nice touch. It is amazingly located by Bryant Park and Times Square (but away from the craziness). Very close to the Metro. The bedding was very comfy (duvet). Room was small, but good for NYC standards. No view, but not a problem. We'd love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The best location for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Pdtugs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, the location is amazing. First time in New York. Took bus from Newark airport for 27 return, drop off is less than two blocks from hotel. Times square is two blocks away. Great restaurant two doors from hotel where you can get a full breakfast for,under 10. Rooms are small but if you have travelled in Europe this should not bother you. Who spends time in their room while in New York anyway. The hotel,offers military rates which were very reasonable. I will stay here again and will recommend to friends and family. Thank you for a wonderful stay. CS

Reviews.Title: “My favorite.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkBaci
Reviews.Content: Expensive but my favorite NYC hotel.The staff makes a nobody feel like a somebody without being pretentious.Too bad the health inspector made them put a leash on Matilda, the hotel cat. Next time I want to see the cabaret act in the Oak Room.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Property”
Reviews.Author: shakedownstreet
Reviews.Content: The Algonquin Hotel was a great place to stay for the weekend. Rooms are small, but if you are on the go like we were, the only time we were in the room was to sleep and regroup. Only a few blocks from Times Square, 30 Rock, and many of the Broadway theaters on a very quiet and uncongested street. Employees were helpful when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but old hotel with small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: knightline
Reviews.Content: Marriott took over this classic NYC hotel around a year ago. It is nice, but since it was built in 1902 it suffers from the same problem virtually all hotels from that period suffers from - small rooms! The location is terrific if you're in town for the theater. Fabulous BBQ restaurant across the street towards 6th Ave. The but was old and high - tough to step over!! If you can ask for a upgrade to larger rooms - don't know if they have that choice available. If you are a couple I'd recommend staying at a more modern marriott like the Marquis or even the Renassaince on 39th & 6th. Both have larger rooms and are Marriotts. Elevators are slow - another sign of an old hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwaihir57
Reviews.Content: The Algonquin is small and the rooms tiny but my husband and I adore this small jewel. I've never liked big hotels no matter how luxurious. We feel at home here, spending a fall afternoon in the lobby, snuggled into a soft chair or sofa behind a palm with a newspaper, having something to munch on and tea or a cocktail. The decor and ambience of the lobby and small dining room make me feel like I have slipped back to the elegance of another time where time is slow and easy. The staff is attentive and many of them have been there for decades and that enhances the feeling of timelessness. If you like excitement, crowds, noise, lots of room and a modern atmosphere, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “A throwback to yesteryear...”
Reviews.Author: ValleyVoyagerMangia
Reviews.Content: The Algonquin is a true throwback to the age of the Broadway boutique hotel. You can see and taste the history everywhere you look. The 44th Street location is perfectly situated near all things Broadway. My room was tiny, but adequate for my needs. The one gripe I have is consistent with what I have read from many other reviewers...the prices in their adjoining bar and restaurant are offensively exorbitant. Why not offer a few room service choices in the 5-10 dollar range...do quesadillas really need to cost 20.00? Are you embedding saffron threads in the salsa? I am a frequent "Marriotter" but it feels like this property is a bit out of touch. I recommend that management spend a bit of time reading comments and reviews online...you will see countless critical references to the uber-expensive vittles you offer. Also, although wireless was free in rooms...the Business Center charges by the minute. I would love to understand the reasoning behind this. All in all...a very good experience. Front desk folks were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Too small. Terrible service. PENNY IS JUST PLAIN RUDE AND DISRESPECTFUL.”
Reviews.Author: bigboats123
Reviews.Content: Too small terrible service. Penny at front desk is rude and disrespectful to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: groovyguitar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful bijou spot of old world charm in modern decor. It has loads of personality. The room was smaller than I had hoped but that may have been me having huge expectations of the hotel. Staff were wonderful, rooms were comfortable and overall the place was a little different.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel.. but not as we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Pimdesign
Reviews.Content: Look, you go to all this trouble to find the best deal, the best location a great hotel and good reviews and then you arrive. Well I have to be honest i genuinely thought the hotel being in New york would be way bigger than it was... but having said that you doorman greets you and you walk right in to the very small entrance lobby in front of the reception desk. As you look around you are thrown back in time... a bit like the old movies in the 1920's. Very beautiful... colourful, but very subdued lighting. The staff are so helpful and courteous, but beware of the tip culture here. We were taken to our room on the top floor, 12th to be exact. The room was just a bit bigger than the King Size bed that filled the room and had a bathroom and wardrobe that made my own space at home look enormous. All that said this was very nice. Large screen opposite the bed on the wall, desk, mirrors, iron and ironing board all there for us. Best thing about the States and no difference here for me was the free wifi. Allowed us to use our iPad whilst there all the time. After three nights our daughters joined us and we upgraded to suite. One person that stood out for over and above all the staff was Terrin. What an ambassador for the hotel! This guy is responsive by email, friendly and welcoming in person and never once left me feeling he was waiting on a tip. A genuinely nice guy that helped make our stay special. As I said, we changed rooms to a suite on the 10th floor. Wow! all I can say is pay the extra! The room was way bigger than our first room and that was just our room. Then we had a full sized lounge which was converted to sleep my daughters. Oh, I nearly forgot... the location is incredible. Come out of the froth door, turn right and walk about 5 minutes and you're in the heart of time square. Would I stay here again... sure... I would be nuts not to!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Personality Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: michellecam
Reviews.Content: This is coming alittle late but I had not realized I had not written a review on it sooner.......We went as a family in June and booked through priceline.com and got a great deal on this hotel!!! But when booking through priceline I seem to think they do not offer all the extras that you get when booking through themselves.....no mention of breakfast vouchers etc.......but the money we saved bought me breakfast, lunch and dinner for a few days lol.....so no big deal.....I get it.......The lobby and facade of the Holel is so old world Hollywood/Business feel to it.....The history is fantastic and Matilda the cat terrific....Rooms are trendy but way to small for more then two,....but this is New YORK!......old Iron stairs were real cool.....elevator very slow at times but again this is a old Hotel so we have to take the good with the bad........Locations was perfect few blocks away from it all!!! I took my 10 and 8 year old and they fell in love with New York city and this Hotel!!!......They walked and walked and loved the bus tours and Central Park and the Museums.....so don't let anyone say that New york is not for kids!!!....only thing missing was a pool ...but who the heck has time for that in New York City.....oh and real important is there is parking right across the street.....$35.00...only down fall....notices a nice scratch on my bumper that I know for a fact happened there....I had hand washed my Jeep just before we left and noticed it when we got to first gas station...tooo late to turn it around to complain....so take pictures of your car in the parking lot before you walk away......because then you have proof if this happens to you too....they sqeeze them in like sardines nooo joke.. made for a nice expensive bill at the end of mine holiday!!!! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good not Great, sorry but rooms not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: CathP027
Reviews.Content: We booked throught bidding Priceline about a year ago so we had a great rate of $199/night plus taxes which may account for the room we had....but if your hotel is claiming 4 star should not all the rooms measure up to that rating????? I was prepared for a small room but did anticipate "charming"..as you might expect in Europe. The staff are excellent, the lobby is lovely however the regular rooms (I am sure the suites are much better) were "just basic" bed was good, room was clean but the room was so small (and we have travelled Europe extensively and this is the smallest room we have ever had) the bathroom was tiny and old, they do have free coffee in the lobby BUT no coffee maker in the room, no bar fridge in the room and you need to get ice from room service. Due to a last minute change in plans our NYC portion of our trip was 4 nights not 3 which were booked with the Algonquin..so I had to scramble to get a room for our additional night. The Algonquin only had rooms avail starting at $450 so did a priceline bid expanding our search to other areas of NYC so our first night in the city was in the Empire State Building area at the Affinia Dumont hotel which was fabulous (their lobby was small) BUT huge newly renovated beautiful room, separate kitchen, loved the location again through priceline last minute at $299 + taxes and worth every penny. Hindsight ...we would gladly pd the higher price for all 4 nights at the Affinia. Suggestion to the Algonquin...when your guests are assigned to those tiny rooms I would suggest you throw in some comps like breakfast or a drink at the bar as goodwill to offset the likely disappointment in the room size.

Reviews.Title: “service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: GlamourGaltraveller
Reviews.Content: Just checked in and the Ann at the front desk is really sweet, professional and very accomodating. While I was waiting for my room i tried their pulled pork appetizer... kind quick service and it was DELICIOUS! Definitely a treat and a surprise. The room is clean, generous (for NYC - midtown) and has a desk, free internet and a safe. Really looking forward to my stay and interacting more with the friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Stay at the Algonquin”
Reviews.Author: Anget09
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stumbled upon the Algonquin by pure luck! Not only were we blown away with the character and charm of this FANTASTICALLY located hotel, we were more than impressed with the attention and service we received from the hotel staff during our stay. We stayed in a standard room, two single beds, free wifi, two bath robes, nice bathroom, TV, ipod docking station, etc. The Algonquin offers free coffee/tea to it's guests on the 2nd floor 24 hours a day via a single serve Tassimo (or something similar) machine, this was great in the morning when I was up early and needed to catch a train! The hotel is about 2 minutes walking from Times Square, 10 minutes from Central Park, and 1 minute to 5th Avenue. The bar is really nice and has a replica 'round table' that Dorothy Parker and her mates used to convene around every day back in the early 1900s. Very nice hotel to stay in while visiting New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room small but nice”
Reviews.Author: RedSavage
Reviews.Content: We got a pretty good rate here, so decided to stay for our NYC weekend. I'm a Marriott Gold member, so when we checked in, we got vouchers for free breakfasts every day and a free drink. Nice! Our room was pretty small, but it seemed newly decorated and was very nice. The elevators could have been an issue. There were only 2 and they were pretty small. Sometimes there was a fairly long wait for one and we were on the 10th floor! The breakfasts were fabulous. The vouchers were for continental breakfasts, but we could order whatever we wanted and just apply the cost to it. The service and food were both good and the setting was historic and unique! The midtown location was really convenient. We were close to Times Square and it was a short walk to a subway station. We had no problem getting around the city form here. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Update is due”
Reviews.Author: TW747
Reviews.Content: Nice old hotel in the heart of Times Square. However, at $300 plus per night, this is not the level of hotel I would expect from Marriotts Autograph collection. I was extremely disspointed. We arrived on Thursday 10 Aug, and checked out today 13 of Aug. The rooms have no hot water by 9 AM, and you are lucky if both of the lifts are working. We spent 30 minutes this morning trying to get on a lift to get our luggage to the lobby. Wine prices in the lobby are ridiculous, about 500% above standard retail for the cheapest wine. We will probably go to the City Center hotel on our next trip. This was OK, but a dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cjd-69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, mid-week in a room on the 4th floor. The staff is very accommodating, the restaurant/lounge/lobby still a great place. The elevators need a real update. Charming doesn't work when one of the 2 goes down. There are 2 stairways, which is nice. The room had been updated somewhat recently although the bathroom wasn't. The tub was old and very tired. They did fit it with one of the new bowed shower curtains but it was a massive old porcelain tub with bad grout on the tiled walls above it. For a comfortable, relatively quiet room in the middle of mid-town, the $500 per night is about what one would expect. Perfect location to the Harvard Club, NY Yacht Club, Theaters, Times Square and shopping. Again, the staff were very friendly and helpful. That makes a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: “NIce getaway”
Reviews.Author: teatime679
Reviews.Content: Nice stay at the Algonquin for a weekend theater getaway. Room was upgraded to a king- very comfortable bed. Great location. Rooms are small as this is an old hotel- not unlike Historic Horel rooms in DC

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jamie L
Reviews.Content: Dirty.... microscopic SMALL rooms maybe 50 square feet. 4 stars never maybe 1 if even. No air conditioning. Worse than any hotel I have ever stayed in. I wouldn't stay here again for free.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: GeoSims
Reviews.Content: While the lobby continues to attract, the rest of the hotel is in bad need of some basic upgrades ( particularly the furniture, carpets, window treatments etc...)

Reviews.Title: “A neat experience”
Reviews.Author: ladyvet27
Reviews.Content: Due to the early snowstorm in October, I found myself stranded at the airport. Searching for available hotels, I saw a good deal on this hotel. The hotel is beautiful and historic. My room was very small, but I enjoyed the atmosphere. The location is terrific, and you can walk to Times Square, Broadway, and 5th avenue for shopping. The lobby is gorgeous, but the drinks are EXPENSIVE. I had one drink to celebrate the experience (a Manhattan), and with tax and tip it was $26! I hear they are renovating in early 2012.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel steeped in history”
Reviews.Author: Natalie1408
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Algonquin for another great stay. The lobby is an oasis of civility in the Times Square district. We invited friends for drinks and dinner under the painting of literary icons. Rooms are small which is no surprise but have comfy beds. Very helpful staff.The Algonquin is a convenient location for the Broadway theaters. Walking to MOMA and along 5th Avenue are pleasures of a fall weekend in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Historical charm and Refinement - Great for Groups & Families”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: I made a last minute switch to the Algonquin and I am so glad that I did! The Algonquin is the perfect place for families and large groups to relax and stay comfortably in New York City. I found that I could get a king suite with a sleeper sofa at reasonable rate in the Algonquinplus get breakfast at the Roundtable in the morning with a couple complimentary cocktails at the Blue Room too - plus discounted parking across the street. The Algonquin was a tremendous value for our family compared to similarly located properties with adjoining rooms. The bell captain, Jimmy, was enthusiastic, warm and welcoming. He and the Algonquin staff were more than accomodating to our family. The staff were very polite to our girls telling them stories of the hotel, pointing out the artwork and engaging them in dialogue much as they did with we adults. The staff was professional, prompt and made our stay special - far to contrary of some other poor reviews. The Algonquin's suites are spacious by NYC hotel standards and comfortably accomodated my wife and I and our children. The lobby lounge is first class with its dark wood panels, comfort and class. Our Saturday night stay (during the October snowstorm) found the hotel quite a happening spot at the lounge, Blue Bar and restaurants. The Algonquin is a historic place you can call your home away from home perhaps that is why it continues to this day. You can stay comfortably and slow down at this respite in the city. The Algonquin is the perfect place for families and large groups to stay and celebrate being together. I cannot wait to come back to this property on my next stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Soak up history and enjoy great location for theatre”
Reviews.Author: BethLD
Reviews.Content: By 1925 The Alonquin Round Table was famous - one of the most profound influences on the times was the group who lunched together here for more than a decade. The Round Table embodied the era, and the Marriott has done a good job at maintaining the ambience, including maintaining the tradition of keeping a cat that has the run of the lobby. The wallpaper on some of the floors, at least, is New Yorker cartoons. I enjoyed soaking up the history -- and sightings of Matilda (the cat). The room was comfortable & clean; staff were all consistently helpful. The rooms are small, but so are other New York older hotels. The location is FANTASTIC for the theatre district. If I could afford it, I would stay here frequently.

Reviews.Title: “"Ready for the planned renovations"”
Reviews.Author: HoyaBAMD
Reviews.Content: Agree with HiroKop11. The public spaces are fun and the staff are very nice and attentive, but the rooms are tiny (like most old hotels) and are very much in need of renovation. The bathroom tub, I think was original. The rooms were clean though. The hotel location is fantastic for Midtown, especially theater district and the bars were lively with very good cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four-star property”
Reviews.Author: HiroKop11
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed soaking up the history and ambience of this hotel's public spaces. But our room was unbelievably small (e.g.,not one drawer to put anything away!) and badly in need of maintenance (e.g., bathroom shelf coming off the wall). Great location but I'd ask lots of questions about your specific room before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in a big city”
Reviews.Author: kitty-belafontaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Algonquin for only two nights before a cruise back to the UK. We found it to be the perfect retreat from the bustle of the Midtown New York. We were on the 12th floor and found it to be relatively quiet given how noisy New York is. The room had everything you needed including ear plugs and was elegantly decorated. Small by US standards but nothing out of the ordinary in European terms. The fittings in the bathroom are especially nice. The lobby is rather lovely as are the cocktails although expensive we spent $60 on a sparkling water and 2 martinis. We didn't eat there but the food going by us on trays looked and smelled marvellous and there were plenty of people partaking. Check in and out was painless and efficent. The coffee station of the second floor was handy, on one occasion we happened to be grabbing a cup when one of the staff was incredibly sweet to us, he was clearing up from a meeting and insisted on getting us larger cups from the kitchen than the ones provided pouring us Starbucks coffee and giving us free range to the big trays of cookies that were left. We were really touched that he went the extra mile to make us feel at home, and in a city that is supposed to be full of attitude he was one of the many lovely people we met. We didn't use the gym, walking Manhatten was enough exercise for us. I would defnitely go back and I would also recommend the hotel as it is a little oasis of calm in Midtown. I've only marked it down because our room was at the back and overlooked a rather uninspiring courtyard. Had we been on the front with a view it would have got a five.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Melsteens3
Reviews.Content: I chose the Algonquin for it's location and the ability to use Mariott points. I wanted something 'different' and not the standard hotel experience and I wasn't disappointed. From the dark paneled lobby to the window seat in our room, every aspect of our stay was delightful. Yes, the room was small but it's a historic hotel...in New York City. The bed was luxurious and the bath towels were thick and plush. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cocktails in a gorgeous setting!”
Reviews.Author: foodieintally
Reviews.Content: I never miss visiting the Algonquin at cocktail hour. The lobby area is restful, beautifully furnished with period lamps and comfortable couches and chairs, and the service is impeccable. They make the perfect Manhattan, the drink of choice in its namesake city. A real plus is Matilda, the cat, who is the reigning feline. She can usually be found overseeing the lobby. If you're into literary history, this is the site of Dorothy Parker's Round Table - a slice of history you can envision in the lovely surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready to feel like royalty”
Reviews.Author: beatam007
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of it's location, history and the fact that is has a resident cat. Unfortunately Matilda (the cat) was at the kitty spa for the weekend, but the hospitable staff more than made up for her absence. It started with the doorman, who was quick to welcome us-curbside and grab our bags. Everyone from the front desk staff, to the bellmen, to the housekeeping staff were, simply put...NICE!!! Everyone made us feel warmly welcomed and totally appreciated. This is not a big fancy hotel, but it has character and although on the smaller side has an old school feeling of grandness. Our room was nothing short of a shoebox, but it had everything we needed and for a change the A/C was super cold! We enjoyed breakfast in the main (lobby) area and it was delish! Although we didn't wake-up early enough to get some free Starbucks (served daily from 6am-9am in the lobby) one of the bellmen was gracious enough to walk us up to the 2nd floor where they have a set-up with a keurig machine and made ourselves a cup of coffee and tea. It was a nice little touch, I even stopped to play the piano in the the adjoining room :) Did I mention that they put out (complimentary) bottles of H2O in the room? NYC tap is actually pretty good, but a few bottles of water is always nice to have on hand. Also, free wi-fi :) FYI: valet parking is =$55, but after enduring the protesters occupying Times Square, I just wanted out of the car and didn't care who parked it! There is a garage literally across the street from the hotel if you want to save a few bucks. I am quite a finicky person, I promise you, if you stay here-you will not be disappointed...as long as you know what kind of hotel this is! Make note...it's not a resort-type hotel. No pool, no gym, no 'spa', no ice/soda machines on each floor (room service will be more than happy to deliver you a bucket of ice, just call)...none of those types of amenities, BUT! the location is great...steps from Times Square, not to mention some great shopping on 5th Ave and the staff really go out of your way to make your stay perfect! PS-the bed is heavenly...best nights sleep in a hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing repeat(several times) visit”
Reviews.Author: simmie17
Reviews.Content: I will begin that I still think if you want a small one bedroom suite with living room with sofabed and need to be in theatre district, this is still your best bet, especially if you get a package with breakfast (they do continental but let you add on regular items at a small fee) and drinks. That said, I would not stay here again unless had to. Service has really declined. I was here before and after Marriott, and even my last stay- under Marriott- was better . Housekeeping is hit or mess. There is generally no doorman, and half the time you need to find a cab on your own. Room service is fine, as are drinks in the lobby. We stayed because we were seeing shows, but the "protesters" almost disrupted that Sat night. Taxis in NYC are still awful and decide if they want to take you depending on where you are going. The rickshaws are also scamming people by charging exorbitant rates. If in the area, try the Lambs Club for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a make-over”
Reviews.Author: PeterthePilot080
Reviews.Content: Nicely situated, but somewhat pricey($450). Unable to get room until about 4pm, which was a huge inconvenience. The elevators are inadequate for the size of the accomodation. Nice resident cat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!! Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: NickWelford
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on a deal through Priceline for £101 for 1 night and to be honest even though the location is great the room was tiny!!! I just hope the people paying regular rates of $500 plus get value for money because even for £100 i feel like i stayed in a broom cupboard a very clean one but tiny. I can only imagine you only get this room if booked through a discount hotel site. Didn`t really take much in about the history of the hotel as was very tired from a long days travel. Probably would not stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We are a family of five and had a suite (2 adjoining rooms) for a 3 night stay. Rooms are small but given the amount of time you spend in them, they were a fair size. We really enjoyed the history of the hotel which was well preserved. The location was also great, close to Times Square, great restaurants - all within walking distance. I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed this historical property”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: I considered The Algonquin amongst a few other Midtown properties for using Marriot points, and some of the negative reviews, here, had put me on edge. But I figured that it had only been a year since it became an Autograph Collection hotel, and I was richly rewarded for my choice, as I had a very pleasant two-night stay. I encountered none of the problems reported by others. My room was clean and well-appointed, and the staff was friendly. It was clear they had put some money into the rooms, recently. The room was decently-sized for a hotel of this age, but I still wouldn't suggest it for more than yourself or a couple. The historical ambiance of the hotel was very cool, and the location is nearly unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a very cool art deco retro feel. As you walk in it's like stepping back in time. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was small but the bed was huge. Bathroom and shower were a good size, TV had loads of chanels. View of the fire escape didn't cause a problem as we were in New York to see the sites and shop, not sit in our room. You could hear the air con from the building next door, although this sent me to sleep more than anything else. Alll in all a lovely hotel. Bar drinks, as with most hotels were expensive. Cocktails were $20 each but were not mixed very well so avoid these. Hotel has a pet cat as well, Matilda.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: traveltimeusa
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Small room but everything you need. Free wifi, free bottle water, robe, safe, nice sheets, comfortable bed. It is an old historic hotel but very charming. They had little notes around the room on how to turn on tv, work the tub drain, the radio I loved that. They have a resident cat. The staff was great. The bar and restaurant were to expensive for us, but lots of food available nearby. Locations was perfect, two blocks from Time Square, about 4 or 5 blocks from Grand Central very easy walk. Subway nearby. Stayed in 5 hotels this trip and this was are favorite. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No customer service and very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: erc421
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel, so I didn't expect much, but at least the customer service could have been better. The morning of my departure, I asked the front desk where I could print my boarding pass, and they told me, very rudely "There's a business center, but you need a key, and good luck because the printer doesn't work." They gave me no other options. The room next to ours was very loud and the walls are very thin...they were playing loud music until very late, smoking pot which smelled up the entire hallway as well as our room, and the walls were so thin that we could hear every word they were saying. Forget about the street noise, the adjacent room noise was much worse. The front desk people were cold and rude and if you stay on a higher floor, be prepared to wait for a while for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: egreen38
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this old hotel. The main part of the hotel is very atmospheric. The staff were ok, not too helpful. Our bedroom was a reasonable size for New York, but the lighting was terrible. The bath in the bathroom was too high as was the mirror in the bathroom (I am 5ft tall). Not much room to put anything. Be careful if you are making a telephone call from the room, we made three calls (short ones) and were charged $60!!!. When we complained we were told by the front desk that the hotel doesn't make the charges it is a company!!! We were really horrified by this amount. Situation of the hotel is good, but I don't think we will return, it is very expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Location. location. location.”
Reviews.Author: thurles2
Reviews.Content: Arrived at alqonquin on 9/11 after making a very late booking, met by very pleasant and welcoming front desk no probs on checkin, a very oldfashioned feel to all areas did not realise how historic the hotel was it felt like being back in the 1930s you could sense at any moment douglas fairbanks walking through the front door. it was really close to times square and bryant park, a few mins walk and you were at all the tourist spots, a very nice comfortable hotel, if you get the right price you cant go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Frustrated”
Reviews.Author: FFXmom4600
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes this hotel could cater to a business traveler. So disappointed to find its charming ambiance meant I'd spend first hour of my stay trying to figure out wireless access. Charm can only go so far without the basic amenities. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No customer service here”
Reviews.Author: Aruba76
Reviews.Content: Even though this is a hotel with lots of history and in a great location, the atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired. Upon check in we were greeted by a woman who apparently does not like her job, or else is tired of telling everyone their room is not ready. Granted, we were 30 minutes earlier than their posted check-in time, but, in a very monotone, unfriendly voice, she told us our room was not ready, and that the housekeeping staff had a different timetable than the rest of the hotel. When we finally were able to get into our room, we had to wait quite a while for our bags to be brought up. They finally were, after having to make a phone call to the front desk to ask where they were, and then receiving a phone call 5 minutes later, asking what our bags looked like. This was after having left our claim check with the front desk - the bags person said he never received it. We finally received our bags soon thereafter, and they were delivered by a very friendly man - one of the few we encountered. The room itself was ok - supposedly it had just been redone, but apparently the only 're-do' was adding pretty colors - nothing practical about it. We were in a suite because we had met our adult son there and we wanted to stay together. The bathroom was located inside the bedroom, so if our son (who slept on the pull-out sofa in the living room) had to use the bathroom during the night, he would have disturbed us sleeping in the bedroom. The bathroom was very small with virtually no vanity space to put our things, and the bathtub was so high I had trouble stepping into it to take a shower (I am 5'). Anyone with even slight mobility issues would not be able to use the tub/shower. The lighting was horrible and I was unable to put on any makeup because of that, but also because the mirror over the very high sink (again a problem for me because of my height) was also very high and I could not see into it. When we arrived back at our room after an evening out, we were greeted by a very strong smell of marijuana from the room next door. The walls are very thin, and the music and conversation from this same room next door was very loud - we could have joined their conversation if we were so inclined. Our suite was in a corner at the end of a hall, so this one room was the only adjacent room. I am guessing that if you are in a regular room, you would be treated to the voices and conversations on both sides. More surprises in the morning - the new drapes covering the windows were decorative only - the morning light poured in as soon as the sun came up in both the living room and in the bedroom. No black-out curtains here! Upon check-out, we asked where my son could print his boarding pass. He was told by a woman at the front desk (a clone of the woman the day before, personality-wise) that IF the printer was working, we would have to pay for it, and the point was moot anyway, because she told us we needed a room key to be able to use the computer, and we had already checked out. Absolutely no interest in helping us out - none of the friendliness and 'go the extra mile' we have seen in other Marriott hotels. Needless to say, it was one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “New York History, at a price”
Reviews.Author: aurorio
Reviews.Content: Here's the thing about the Algonquin: it is a beautiful, historic hotel, but unless you can get a cheap rate, it's almost not worth it. The lobby area is gorgeous and the upstairs halls, papered in New Yorker cartoons, are charming. I wanted to stay at the Algonquin because it has been a part of Manhattan history, unlike most of the faceless chain hotels. Ultimately, I was kind of disappointed, because everything seems to have a catch: the room was very comfy, but small. My room was in the back, away from the street noise, but my windows looked out onto an adjoining fire escape. It's not that it's bad, or uncomfortable, but the whole stay I was aware that for the same rate, I could be staying somewhere bigger, nicer, and with a view of the city. You're paying for a name, essentially, and while I overall enjoyed the hotel, I probably won't go back. However, it should be noted that the staff is very friendly and always ready with an interesting fact about the hotel. Everyone made me feel comfortable and at home, including the cat! My advice would be to find a cheap rate or stay elsewhere and go to the Algonquin for drinks or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star room”
Reviews.Author: Philip R
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a '4-star' room at this hotel during a recent stay in Mid-Town Manhattan. Although the hotel is a classic and has all the features that come with that, one was unfortunately the AC in the room. Upon entering I note that in addition to the built-in wall AC, there is a window unit. It was somewhat warm in the room. The built-in was on and blowing warm air. Adjusting the setting did not do anything. So I fire up the window AC - which I would bet is inconsistent with the definition of a 4-star room, and although it worked - it was noisy. I was really to tired to deal with a service call, so I put in my earplugs and went to bed. The window unit was load enough to keep me awake with earplugs, so I bit the bullet and turned it off - only to find - that wasnt the noise! The noise was the back alley and a mult-thousand ton rooftop evaporative cooling tower for some other building - humming away at a racket pace throughout the night - oh joy. So most of the noise was coming through the cheap side panels of the window AC unit and wasnt mutable. If I wasnt exhausted I'm afraid I would not have gotten any sleep - even with earplugs. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and full of History.”
Reviews.Author: poohkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Algonquin for one night during a freind's Bachelorette. The hotel is right next to Times Square. A bit of a fiasco to travel to if you're driving. But if you're looking for an authentic NYC experience, you can't go wrong here. We valeted our car for $50/night next to the hotel. Bellman was so helpful and friendly. Staff was great too. We checked into our tiny room and were happy with the decor, linens and quality. I loved that the hotel had an old time feel about it but be warned that the rooms are tiny. Even for NYC standards. 3 of us shared a room and I brought an airbed that I squeezed next to the door that night. The elevators are old too and take a while to arrive. But the unique charm and old fashioned tranditions, make this a special place.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: cmk1014
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a weekend in New York. We chose this hotel because I had purchased it through a shopping site. From the moment we arrived, the staff treated us as if we were frequent guests. We had lunch in the Blue Bar where Henry took excellent care of us! His recommendation for the salmon carpaccio was incredible and definitely the best I've ever eaten! Both Henry and Otto were wonderful hosts and made sure that we had everything we needed. Germaine made sure that our car was brought to us promptly. The hotel lobby has so much character.....from Matilda, the resident cat in the lobby (who KNOWS she's a star) to the charm and attention placed on every detail, the lobby was a testament to the quality of the hotel and the pride they place in their history. We have stayed at a number of fine hotels in New York, but I would definitely recommend this one! Great location, beautiful space and incredible staff!

Reviews.Title: “Timeless personality. Just Charming and classy.”
Reviews.Author: kcanavan2010
Reviews.Content: The Experience is worth every penny but try to find a deal in advance as it is expensive. You can meet their cat (matilda), chat with an old time bar tender, get some inspiration from the new yorker, read international newspaper. The staff makes you feel at home and the food and cocktails are worth trying. The location is close to perfect. Only flaw is the street noise but they provide ear plugs to deal with it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with another couple stayed at the Algonquin over the Labor Day hoilday long weekend. Prior to our arrival, the hotel's Operations Manager (Abeer) was extremely helpful in answering our questions and arranging limo service to and from the airport. She is truely and asset to the hotel. We were greeted with a smile from everyone we encountered and we treated like we were their best guests. The hotel is very unique and very impressive. Location is great, one block for Times Square and walking distance to many great restaurants, shopping and attractions. The Algonquin will be our "home away from home" when we vist the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - and historic - lobby bar & lounge BUT RUDE as all get out waiters”
Reviews.Author: jim s
Reviews.Content: We popped in for a drink where Dorthea Parker and her gang drank - had the most arrogant waiter - totally ignored us...put a damper on our excitement.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: dhkessler
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect for us. The room was a little small but we were active and not in the room for very long. Very comfortable, housekeeping staff was very helpful, room service fast. The lobby in the hotel was very welcoming as were all of the staff--reception, bellmen, wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Old School”
Reviews.Author: FoxyDon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline at $150 for the night because we literally couldn't afford our previous hotel's $465 a night price tag post Irene and our flights had been cancelled : (. After the ultra sofistication of our previous abode, the Algonquin felt like a 'real' hotel, hard to explain but it was strangely comforting. Room was small, bed super comfortable, bathroom tiny (and almost impossible to get into without physically out-muscling the sticky door), but the whole place was very endearing. We had a Manhatten (in Manhatten) in the Blue Bat and had a lovely chat with Mr. Cwong (??) who enlightened us about Matilda the hotel cat who I had previously thought was fictional.....she's not : ) Only downside was the hotel receptionist (Mr T- that's all I'll say) who was a bit burly and cursed a bit too much considering his job. Don't know if this is his normal demeanour or just because we were priceliners????? All round? Comfortable (apart from the noisy AC - but Matilda does provide you with ear plugs :) :) :) ), great location and for the most part lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, elegant and classic hotel offering "almost like at home" feeling”
Reviews.Author: LW23
Reviews.Content: Reading some mixed reviews I figured that with this hotel you either hate it or love it. Yes, it does have small rooms and does not offer the typical chain hotel standard. Yet, it is extremely cosy, elegant and perfectly located in the heart of the city. Maybe not so much appealing to business travelers it has a lot to offer in terms of interesting interior design, more personal service and very "at home feeling". Rooms are comfortable, staff very helpful and you don't get crowds of people like in some other, huge hotels in the city. Free internet comes as standard feature which is a huge plus. Other than small rooms, I do not see any clear downsides and would definitely recommend it for visiting New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cute Hotel Would Stay Here Again.”
Reviews.Author: aarmstr
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this hotel from the other reviews. Overall I found the hotel to be ADORABLE. The room wasn't too small- I expected it to feel like a closet- but there was plenty of room to walk around- there was a closet available and the bathroom was quite large as well. The bed was great and comfy and most of all the room felt very clean! This hotel has so much charm I absolutely fell in love with it. The shower/tub was strange- but this just added to the appeal of an older hotel. The hotel is a short walk from Times Square. I felt safe in the location and we were able to park across the street with no problems. We enjoyed drinks in the lobby but they were Crazy expensive- even for NYC. We pricelined this hotel and got a great deal. Would def. recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Eegads, this hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Boolie125
Reviews.Content: Rest assured that if Dorothy Parker and Noel Coward were alive today they would not be staying here. Times have changed but the Algonquin has not - in the worst way - it's amenities. I've stayed at old, charming hotels both in the US and abroad but this one is so tired that I could hardly wait to check out. Other business travelers in my group knew better and stayed at the Westin and the Strand. I stayed here given its short walk to business on Fifth Ave but that is all it has going for it. A 4-star hotel - nope - 3-star. I'd say it is one step higher than the rooms at the Union League - and no more. I stayed in both an Algonquin suite and a discounted room and both came up short for their price class. The discounted room had a small toilet stuck in a very narrow corner and lots of stained grout. The door knob to the room was only 2 arm lengths from inside the elevator - no elevator banks here. As for the suite, the couch in the living area was stained, the bathroom was huge but the AC was so SO LOUD that you could not hear the TV when it cycled on every few minutes. The AC vent was also situated near the ceiling and blew towards my head, giving me an earache from the cold. In addition, the standard Marriott bedding is used here and is as skimpy as usual - you can never get warm enough. I can say, however, that the Algonquin does not skimp on the AC like some other Marriotts. The AC is cranked up very high and I was able to turn it off on my last night and still be comfortable in this unusually cool August. The only bright spot is the cozy but grand lobby and roaming Matilda the Cat. Forget the Blue Bar - it is deteriorating and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, delightful public areas, great cocktails”
Reviews.Author: tnsc
Reviews.Content: The Algonquin is a classic. Rooms are not large, but it reflects the time it was built. Very clean, in excellent condition. Everything works. Close to Times Square. Guests include folks from many nationalities, age groups. Quite comfortable ambience.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was in a MadMen episode”
Reviews.Author: bnhall
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Algonquin for a few days in mid-August. The hotel is in a pretty good location in midtown, with convenient access via walking or taxis. The hotel has a real (but faded) charm, with a lobby bar filled with theater goers or ladies-who-lunch types. The rooms are very small, even for Manhattan, and my room (815) had only a single bed. The room was difficult to move around in given the size. For example at the desk I couldn't scoot the chair back very far without hitting the bed, and I couldn't open the closet door without hitting the desk. The bathroom was very nice, very old school with updated but antique fittings for the sink and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, service & style”
Reviews.Author: nursely
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this hotel for $125/night. It's a block and a half off Times Square on W. 44th St. On one side, a casual diner (Red Flame) and tthe othe side Cafe Boulud. Room was very small, but very quiet ( on the back side of hotel). Bathroom very nice....Robe in closet and toiletries provided. Service is excellent...wonderful beds and bedding...any and all requests were handled quickly & well. People who complain about the decor may not realize the literary history of the hotel. Wallpaper in upstairs corridors is all James Thurber cartoons and original iron staircases are displayed rather then hidden behind firewalls. Loved the hotel AND the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good part of town,historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruthyy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for quiet this is not it. You can hear lots of street noise probably from the window air conditioner. Sound just travels right up. The room is clean, small and the bed mattress is too soft. Its definitely on older hotel. Internet was free and there are eating places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient older hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: Lexis042
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August. We got the room off of Hotwire.com for 130$/night. The locations was great, close to all of the action. The rooms are small, but we were only there too sleep. The breakfast is 23$... kind of pricey, but again we weren't eating, just sleeping and then off again. The service was good, the hotel lobby is very vintage and classy looking, we really liked this. There's a diner next door which is convenient for breakfast, there's also a "Pret a Manger" around the corner about 1 or 2 blocks which is great for breakfast or lunch, great prices and fresh food. I would recommend this hotel for short stays and if you can get a deal it's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amp322
Reviews.Content: Great service. Professional and prompt. Needed to change my date of stay, and the reservations desk was very accomodating, and friendly. Had a package deal, which included drinks at the bar, and breakfast. Room was very nice. Nothing fancy, but had all the old world charm in tact, with all the modern conveniences. Drinks and food were excellent. Lobby lounge was beautiful. Location of the hotel is perfect for sight-seeing in midtown, and it's one block from the Broadway theater action. You can self park across the street, at the Hippodrome. A classy hotel, for people who like history and elegance, but who also want comfort and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Boutique”
Reviews.Author: CyndySue18
Reviews.Content: What a great little place, centrally located with a history in itself. Tucked away just behind Times Square close to everything. Walked everywhere from here. Heritage listed, quaint bedroom and bathroom. Bedroom is small with only space for one suitcase, but plenty of room to spread out in the lounge area. A lovely platter of fruit and welcome card from the manager on our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Dani_197588
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a visit of NYC. The location is great, near Times Square. Rooms are not so big but enough since the main point of the trip is to visit the city, but very clean and confortable. Free wifi conection. Nice place to have breakfast just in front of the Hotel. I sure recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cocktails in their charming lobby, skip the bar”
Reviews.Author: GoKate
Reviews.Content: The interesting movie "Mrs. Parker..." drew me to select this hotel for cocktails and a light snack before spending the evening at a nearby Broadway theater. I foolishly told my husband to meet me in the bar. The bar was fine, appropriately dark and clubby with people having intense business and social interactions. Prior to leaving we walked into the lobby to find the restrooms and realized we missed the charming lobby. The ambiance was gentler, the lighting brighter to better enjoy the art work and fabulous old-world flourishes, the patrons a bit more, uhm, sober. The bell captain warmly thanked us for "gracing the Algonquin" as we left. How often does some say something so dear?" I will try to to back for tea or cocktails during a future visit. Darn. Look twice, sit once.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cynjoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 2 nights in this super hotel and have nothing but good things to say about it. They were accommodating with an early check in and even comped us 2 free cocktails in their famous lobby bar. The suite was spotless and very quiet. I usually have to cajole my hubby to visit NYC as he finds it a wee bit hectic, but he was so impressed with the Algonquin, he says we can come back whenever I want - huge bonus as I love the city. The staff were super friendly and I honestly can't think of one negative thing to say and I'm very picky. Location is perfect and I highly recommend Kellari which is a wonderful restaurant right down the street that has the most amazing fish. If you are looking for a spectacular hotel, The Algonquin is it . Free Starbucks in the lobby in the morning is an added bonus too.

Reviews.Title: “a great piece of New York's history”
Reviews.Author: MRP456
Reviews.Content: A lovely old hotel, brought up to date. Great common areas, small rooms. A very pleasant stay and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, interesting, historic and well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: WallabyGal
Reviews.Content: I bought a 3 one-night packages at the Algonquin on RueLaLa, $200 per night including 2 cocktails and 2 breakfasts per night. I knew about Dorothy Parker & the Round Table, but I wasn't sure what to expect now that it was a Marriott. It couldn't have been a better experience. The rooms aren't huge (kind of typical for NYC), but the beds are comfortable, & there are some older historic touches I liked. Each door has a little quip or saying from people like Dorothy Parker, and there is the "legendary" Matilda the cat roaming the lobby, both adding to the charm and history of the hotel. It was so clear that the staff truly care about the place - rather than a "standard Marriott feel", they were interested in each guest individually & everyone was friendly, kind & helpful (not always the case in NYC). We ate dinner in the restaurant (not the Oak Room which is closed for the summer). I was concerned at first because there wasn't a huge selection, but the dishes were fabulous! I had probably the best tuna I've eaten in NYC (& I've eaten a fair amount there). Our waiter Boris was amazing to chat with, & knowledgeable, & took pride in the restaurant. There are 2 free bottles of water in the room - a huge plus in the heat, and I appreciated not being charged for them. They'd emailed me a "virtual concierge" page where I could ask for certain pillows in the room, other amenities. I wanted only foam pillows & that's what I got. Having the breakfast & cocktails as part of my package was a big plus, because while both were delicious, they were pricey - cocktails were upwards of $20, but they did use unusual ingredients; breakfast was $15 for a pretty basic continental, though a lot of fresh fruit. One very small annoyance - my daughter couldn't eat most of her $20 fruit breakfast, so we asked to have it packaged, & they charged us $3.50 - I've never had that happen. But other than that, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service”
Reviews.Author: chrispusak
Reviews.Content: Our first experience with The Algonquin was Father’s Day weekend 2011 when I booked a room using Marriott points. Was I surprised that all the single rooms had only one bed- a little small for me, my wife and 2 teenage daughters. When I approached the front desk, the woman (whose name I didn’t get) sensed my concern (and fear) that another room at the last minute might not be available and if so, probably at a huge premium. She was able to get me another room and at a discounted price that did not break the bank. Later that week, for my family’s second stay, she had upgraded us to a suite. It was due to this wonderful experience that we rebooked a room for 7/15/11. Our situation was especially difficult as my older daughter was having surgery in NYC (we are from Philadelphia) and she needed to recuperate one night before heading home. Our experience could not have been better. Specifically, the front desk staff of Edwin and Mariel accommodated us for an early check-in and a late check-out with ease. The Bellmen, specifically, Peter and Marcus, responded quickly and graciously for every request which included needing a wheelchair and challenging unloading and loading on the streets of New York. There were many other staff members who made our stay pleasant whom I cannot identify but please thank them all for relieving what was a very stressful 24 hours for our family. You can be sure that The Algonquin will be our hotel every time we stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely hotel with poor staff”
Reviews.Author: NY414
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful. Just like something right out othe pages of history. The staff however, well they were lacking to say the least. When I came to check -in I was clearly bothering Ann, I think that was her name, at the front desk. She was englufed in whatever she was typing and who am I to interupt. The bellman were just as rude. Had to say excuse me as we walked through the front door becuase the doorman and the bellman were standing in the doorway talking. When we had to check bags I was handed a ticket and that was it. No, do you know where you are going or come pick them up here later. Perhaps I am asking for too much. When I checked out I had our bags held, came back later on and stood at the bellstand while the same bellman stood talking to someone else who worked there and kept looking at us. We clearly needed help but he was, again too busy talking to be concerned with us. He finally came over and tells us that he does not have a key, the other bellman has the only key. Our suite was beautiful though. Great touch with the bottles of water and plums in the room. A/C in the bedroom did not work as well as it did in the living room and our bed had no sheet, just a duvet.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star, but has some charm”
Reviews.Author: Dsullivan222
Reviews.Content: Priceline put me here twice, and despite the decent price, I now try to configure my searches to not get put up here again. If you're looking for a 3 star hotel, with a great literary history and a good location, you'll be satisfied, but there's no way this is a 4 star hotel. I travel to NYC about once a month, always get good priceline deals and stay at 4 star hotels, and this one is definitely a significant cut below the rest. Other than those (ugly) sunburst mirrors, the rooms really have no character, the beds are just ok, the TV was lo-def, the heat was a noisy unit by the window, the view was mediocre, and the bathroom was ridiculously small, with a toilet nearly set flush into the corner that requires some kind of side saddle approach by any average sized adult. A friend that stopped up entered the room, immediately pointed at the toilet, and laughed as a first impression. I also stay in a ton of NYC hotel rooms, so it grates a bit when people complain about the size of 4 star rooms (it's Manhattan, get over it) and these were some of the smallest, but what they've done with the space (or failed to) is disappointing. It's not awful, it's just not appealing, and part of my review is against the expectation of a 4 star hotel. If I had the expectation of a 3 star hotel (and the cost) I'd have been relatively happy with it. There's no real lobby except for the restaurant/bar. The bar has some great history and atmosphere (though a decidedly silver haired crowd) but I enjoyed a few very well made $20 cocktails before returning to my generic room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel, comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: marciopsiq
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the 2nd part of trip to always fabulous NYC. This property was a priceline bid winning, and I wish I could win it again everytime I bid for NY hotels! We had already stayed at 44th st and loved the location. The hotel common areas are charming, classic, with great memorabilia from the Dorothy Parker times... and free wi-fi, what unfortunately they do not offer in the rooms. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable, with fine decor, regular size and good bathroom and shower. A convenient plus for us was the two daily complimentary water bottles. We had no view, though, and that was a minus. The staff was professional and since we only needed them to check in and out, I could not evaluate that very well. Loved Matilda at the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best little hotels in NYC”
Reviews.Author: fordad
Reviews.Content: If you're coming to New York City and want a taste of old world charm in the heart of the theatre district - this is the place to be. The Algonquin Hotel has wonderful history but even better a first-rate hotel staff who will make you feel comfortable, secure and welcome. It also boasts a wonderful lobby bar and cabaret room (The Oak Room) that's worth coming by for - even if you dont stay at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and fun”
Reviews.Author: JimS48
Reviews.Content: Compared to many sterile hotels with long straight corridors, try the Algonquin. Rooms are different shapes and quality but clean and acceptable. My latest visit was no exception. Friendly staff, aged elevators (but working) and compact but tidy room. The Blue Bar is still a true NY experience. Long time staff who know their business along with a noisy crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Room in the World!”
Reviews.Author: SonjaWitt
Reviews.Content: My sister always teases me when I check a room's size before booking. Well, I didn't do that this time, and it was a mistake! I didn't measure the room, but I'm certain it was about 12x9! The bathroom was about 6x6, there was one very small closet, and no dresser. The room was comfortable and clean and hotel staff were very cordial and helpful, but the room is way too small for two adult women! No wonder the price was a little more reasonable for midtown.

Reviews.Title: “You have to keep them honest!”
Reviews.Author: ShawnClap
Reviews.Content: Paid for a King room on Orbitz. Checked in, unpacked and noticed that the bed was a smaller than a queen. Called the front desk and was told that they were sorry but they were all out of the king rooms due to faulty AC units. So they tried to sneak us into a smaller standard room and hoped we wouldn't notice? The offered us breakfast and drinks for the inconvenience. After a half hour I realized that the room wasn't getting cooler, despite the (in window) AC unit turned up for max cooling. Went downstairs to ask if they could look at it. They assured me that they would, and my wife & I went out for a late lunch. When we arrived 2 hours I asked at the desk if the AC was fixed, the clerk told me that maintenance didn't put in for a service call, so the AC should be working fine. The room was uncomfortably warm at this point. I went back down to demand that we be switched in to a room with a working AC. And they made the switch. Then, quite mysteriously, a man around showed up around 8:30pm to "fix the closet". He spackled something in the closet wall and told us not to use it. Couldn't this have waited? Other than that our stay was fine. Of course they only served us half the breakfast we ordered despite repeated requests for our toast and side of fruit, but since it was "free" we didn't get upset. It was an amusing stay and reminded us of Fawlty Towers. I'm guessing that this place has had a long slide downhill (and lost much standing) since Marriott took over.

Reviews.Title: “"Great hotel with great staff"”
Reviews.Author: FNY
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Algonquin hotel. We came back for the great location of the hotel and the most welcoming staff. The rooms are comfortable, average decor but great beds and cool airconditioning. We just wish they would change the bathrooms in this hotel. They are extremely small and narrow, and the bathtubs are very old. I understand they have tried to preserve the charm of the hotel, but I don't really enjoy baths in a bathroom like that. Overall, Its a great hotel and I would stay there the next time im in New York.

Reviews.Title: “very, very......noisy”
Reviews.Author: jorgecancun
Reviews.Content: I was staying for four nights, the room is very noisy, in fact in the nightstand can find earplugs. The bathroom is very small and the shower floor seems to be dirty, lacking maintenance. The best hotel is the lobby bar and its location. Definitely would never stay at this hotel, I think you might find a better hotel for the same price

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about missing items”
Reviews.Author: Pepstar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in June with my wife and my 8 month old son. Great points - provided a fridge in the room when requested and a crib for our son. Location was fantastic - close to Grand Central and Byrant Park subway. Free wifi throughout the hotel Good points - bed was super comfy, coffee, tea and papers provided in the foyer for guests to use as they please in the morning, room size was fine for us Bad points - we had some items go missing from our room (we checked our room three times over and all of our luggage before and after getting home - included a swiss army knife (used for cutting up bits of fruit for our son), a utility key and an expensive pair of tweezers - luckily we had used our room safe for all bigger items). The front of house staff were not at all interested in helping us with this or if the items were found after we left, informing us so that we could arrange onward posting. Overall the service wasn't fantastic - we had to ring up on all but one day to request towels and shower gel as they weren't left in the room. Front desk staff from check in to requests throughout our stay seemed reluctant to help us at all and in fact on a couple of occassions were quite rude. Points to note - the noise in our room from the air conditioning was quite loud. It didn't bother us as the white noise helped block out the noise outside the room (from the lifts and also a big conference/business related party that was happening on the 2nd floor on one of the nights). The hotel did provide earplugs in the side drawer though. The bathroom was tiny but adequate. Overall we loved the location, the room was great but the poor level of service and the fact that this is the only hotel in all our travels that we have had items go missing would lead us personally not to stay here again. I have rated it as average because the hotel itself is good but on this occassion we were let down considerably by the service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome spot--hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: danaluvstravel
Reviews.Content: We only got to stay one night unfortunately, but the hotel staff was great, very accomodating, the rooms weren't large (we ended up with a queen bed), and the location was superb. I am pretty picky and had no complaints. The lobby was very nostalgic, but elegant and well kept. It wasn't one of those hotels that looks great from the entry sign then you get inside and it's terrible--no, this one was great all around. And we even got a glimpse of Matilda, the resident cat. Location can't be beaten, for business people and for tourists. Centrally located on a quieter street just off the south end of Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME historic place!”
Reviews.Author: brewsterstravels
Reviews.Content: bit pricy since the renovation, but still worth it. rich in history and ambience. we try to stay here as often as possible. if you love historic old places this is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Intimistic, original & great service”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine_demange
Reviews.Content: A very cosy and original atmosphere right next to Times Square! Simply love the place, the wall paper, the cosy loby, the old fashioned elevator and the despite small rooms, the beds are simply fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE EFFORT---SMALL DINGY/DUMPY ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: 1956RoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Great location is the only NICE thing I can say about this property. I travel on business approx 100 nights/yr and this is by far the worst hotel I have stayed at in quite some time. The rooms are VERY small, 2 VERY small elevators, VERY narrow and noisey hallways; but the worst is the VERY small, dingy bathroom (reminds me of a 1920's style bath WITHOUT any updates. For the life of me I can not see how this property is a 4 Star...nor an category 8 Marriott (Signature). Quaint is one thing, but overall I was EXTREMELY disappointed

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: zazafras
Reviews.Content: The Algonquin staff's service was exemplary. This is our FOURTH stay at the Algonquin within 2 years. We will continue to stay because it feels like a second home, yet BETTER! We booked the "Matilda" package because it was my birthday.The package includes a wonderful, plush toy cat and yummy treats. Edwin at the front desk is outstanding.He knows our names and treats us like royalty. We also were lucky enough to get upgraded accommodations. We requested a refrigerator and that was brought promptly.The beds are the most comfortable and the room is cozy. GREAT flat screens with lots of channels.Edwin takes such good care of us, he should get Employee of the YEAR. I have watched him handle difficult guests with aplomb & finesse.Jeannie at the front desk is always upbeat & friendly. The new Matilda is the best. Sweet & beautiful. Thanks Algonquin for an OUTSTANDING stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, "ok" hotel...”
Reviews.Author: AXO1010
