Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for a business trip. I enjoy choosing Marriott properties b/c I collect the points. The hotel is old and has an antique feel to it. I prefer newer hotels with cleaner lines, but can appreciate the beauty in this. The rooms are very small, the halls are very small... I'm just not used to this. The bathroom was very "dingy". The lobby is small, but warm. They have a resident cat who lives in the lobby / bar which was by far my FAVE thing about the hotel. I wouldn't run to stay here again, but wouldn't be upset if I stayed here again either. Decent place to stay if you want this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Luxurious bedding. Perfect for traveling with teens.”
Reviews.Author: Lorie-McLelland
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to NY. Choosing the Algonquin was the best decision we made! We were close to Times Square. (1 short walk up the block) Our Premiere King Suite had 2 rooms (with a DOOR -- great for privacy), a walk in closet with safe, ironing board/iron, bathroom with large tub/shower and hairdryer. Also provided were a bar, a large assortment of snacks, and a stocked fridge (at a price!) Our king bed was soooo comfortable. Our teenage daughter was comfortable in the next room on the queen sofabed. The BR and LR had a large screen TV. Housekeeping provided us with a free large makeup mirror for use while there (a necessity for a teen and her makeup!) There were great restaurants within a short walk. A convenient 24 hour drug store right around the corner. (I had to go there one night at 3 AM and felt SAFE walking there). There was a great street fair at the end of the block on Saturday. The doormen were so helpful. We're planning our next trip already and it includes another stay at the Algonquin!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again - small rooms though”
Reviews.Author: courtney_meinen
Reviews.Content: Quaint, charming hotel with a lot of history. The rooms are well-appointed but very small. Good location. Loved hanging out in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: tashandmatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children, aged 12 and16 visited here for 5 nights. We had a suite which I felt was a good size. we had a double room with a large walk in wardrobe and the bathroom came off our room. Our children slept on the sofa bed in the lounge area. I couldn't fault the hotel, all the staff were nice it was clean and nicely decorated. we petted the house cat much to my daughters delight! We only ate one meal in the restaurant which was very nice. I would recommend this hotel for families as it gave parents a bit of privacy.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: max10156
Reviews.Content: Lobby and lounge are 4 star, but rooms are not even close. Very, very small (even for NYC) and ordinary. The linens, furnishings and in-room amenities could easily have come from a much lesser chain hotel. The hotel has a nice old new york feel in the common areas, but if that doesn't mean that much to you, spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Gem”
Reviews.Author: HaBarb
Reviews.Content: The Algonquin Hotel is a charming gem of a hotel in convenient midtown Manhattan. I found the service to be outstanding - professional and genuinely friendly. The staff seems really glad you chose their excellent hotel! The rooms are much larger and newer looking than I expected. The Algonquin is now owned by Marriott, so you can earn points for the Marriott Rewards program. As a special bonus, this hotel has a rich literary history that will inspire any writer or reader.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but makes up for it in location”
Reviews.Author: BabyBird_CA
Reviews.Content: Be sure to sign up with the hotel website's e-newsletter. That's how I found out about the 30% off if you book within a 24 hours. With the discount, it's a phenomenal value for the room and location, steps away from Times Square! The hotel itself is filled with history, and actually has a bit of a creepy feel to it (If you're feeling brave, look up the ghost stories online surrounding this hotel beforehand!) The room & adjoining bathroom is quite small, but the accommodations were quite nice. Large screen TV, free wi-fi and a comfortable bed. Considering you're right in the heart of the action in NYC, you'll really only be in your room to sleep anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Totally charming!”
Reviews.Author: cootmom
Reviews.Content: What a lovely and comfortable visit! The lobby alone wafts you back into Round Table days, all dark wood and elegance. My room was truly large enough for two, a rarity in these days of boutique "closets" masquerading as hotel rooms. The staff was so pleasant. The location is not too close to Times Square, across from a great coffee shop, easily reachable by subway. I got a reasonable (for NYC in May) price from Getaroom.com, $267 including all fees, for a Thursday night. The Algonquin is now tied with my other favorite, the Roger Williams, and I like the location even more.

Reviews.Title: “The room was tiny, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Lelentobo
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was really small, however it was neat and cozy. I didn't like the bathroom much, it was not well kept and the bath tub looked like it was as old as the hotel!! I found the hotel itself to be classy and pretty decent. The location is awesome as it's only two blocks away from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kieran15
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New York with my teenage grandson and we were made most welcome by all the staff. We loved the hotel, which was traditional and so different from the usual modern large hotels which you can find in most cities. Read previous reviews and were slightly nervous about our choice. It met all our expectations. Twin-bedded bedroom was more than adequate for us. Bedroom very clean, beds more than comfortable. Great location. We felt very safe in the neighbourhood which was within walking distance of all the sites we wanted to see in New York. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: 3858Sandy
Reviews.Content: We rec'd a gift certificate including two nights, cont. breakfast, taxes, and tips. Great property and location, great service. Only a couple blocks to Times Square. Front desk personnel (especially Jennie) were always friendly and professional. Our deluxe room was small, but updated and spotless. Meals and drinks seemed quite pricey to us and therefore we only ate the continental breakfast (normally $23.) which was part of our gift certificate. Cons? Lighting in the lobby is always low and the resident cat, yes, an old cat, is always on the "prowl. " If I could afford to stay here again, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: luvthehd
Reviews.Content: My s.o. and I stayed here for a weekend in March. Check-in was very efficient. We had a room on the 12th floor. This being NYC and an old building, we knew the room would be small. It was - there wasn't a dresser - just a small closet, desk, and nightstand, but it was fine. Bathroom was very small, but well appointed. Honestly, the charm of the place and it's history was the main reason for staying there and the Algonquin delivered. I just loved it. The narrow staircases with marble steps were a gem, as well as the cat in the lobby. The staff were very pleasant. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't give a recommendaiton about that. They very nicely held our bags after checkout while we roamed around the city before our train left. Great location. And our room was quiet and the bed was super comfortable. The price is high, but that's Manhattan hotels for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Step Back in Time - with GREAT service & Marriott points!!!”
Reviews.Author: c2brooks
Reviews.Content: A beautiful old hotel in a great location with a staff that makes you think you have stepped back in time! The welcome, the conversation, the desire to please and serve exudes from this place. The history of the round table, the clean, comfortable rooms. Not modern, but fashionably historic. One of my new favorite hotels in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: playboyrichard
Reviews.Content: I can't rate this for value as I got a terrific deal on Priceline. So that's worth knowing. All I can tell you are things I noticed. Parking: if you've got a car, forget about cheap or free parking. Car park opposite that they will validate (cost me $35 for 24 hours as a result). Room was small but I think that's how it works in Manhattan. Terrific location slap band in the middle of Midtown, so near Times Square and 42nd Street theatreland. My room had a lovely old big bath with a great shower. Two complimentary bottles of water. No fridge or tea/coffee making facilities. Beautifully comfortable bed. Decent wardrobe space. Rubbish view of back of buildings (again, I think this is common in the city) Wonderfully characterful hotel, proud of its artistic history. Free wifi in rooms. Pleasant reception staff, allowed me to check in a bit earlier than normal (at about 1pm).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: mandm329
Reviews.Content: The second we walked in the door, we were greeted by friendly hotel workers who immediately got us to our room. Although the room was somewhat small, it is an older hotel and most hotels in NYC have smaller rooms. The bathroom was a good size though, and everything worked just fine. The best parts of the hotel are the unique decor of the lobby, the classy chairs and sofas in the lounge area, and the fun New Yorker cartoons on the wallpaper. Also, the Algonquin is only a few blocks from Times Square, and it was unbelievably quiet! I recommend ordering a drink in the lounge. It's a little expensive, but well worth it! All in all, we had a very comfortable stay and we'd be happy to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Slow start but great stay”
Reviews.Author: TheLSUguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in April. We arrived on a Wednesday night and were told they had overbooked, but they had us a room right down the street at Hotel Mela. I was a little bit perturbed, but I was on vacation so I tried to just be rational. The Night manager, Nelson, was very apologetic and offered us free breakfast for the remainder of our stay and free drinks the next evening. That was sufficient as the bellhop who was very nice carried our luggage and got us checked in at the Hotel Mela(which was not as nice as the Algonquin, but good for just laying our heads down in a good, clean, new hotel after a long day of travel). We checked in the next morning and had a very nice room. The rooms were extremely clean, regardless of what anybody else has said. We enjoyed breakfasts every morning at the hotel in a very nice lobby and were helped by a friendly concierge before we left in the morning to help direct us around the city. I booked on Priceline last time, but on my next trip to the city I will book through this hotel directly. The location is second to none and the staff was accommodating after the initial problem.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: marietatest6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the purpose of business travel. The hotel itself was in Midtown, close to subways, Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The hotel itself has some lovely period details. The rooms, typical of any NYC hotel, are small but more than adequate considering you should only be there to sleep anyway. Quite clean, too. Ultimately, travelers will enjoy stepping back in time while still benefitting from modern-day amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: lglvr
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for one night and I was so impressed with many details of our stay. I booked the Algonquin via the Marriott website (Marriott Reward Member). It is close to everything! Great restaurants in the area. Duane Reade (essential for those little items) just around the corner. The parking garage across the street was very reasonable to my surprise. The hotel was fantastic. It was so nice to stay at someplace 'different' than the usual modern hotels I am used to visiting. The hotel was lovely. Historical old New York. I had never experienced something to refreshing. Best of all was the staff. WOW!!! Friendly and helpful is an understatement. They couldn't have been more wonderful! I travel ALL the time and this will remain on the top of my list for NY hotel close to everything! Best of all, my daughter received "Matilda" the cat when we arrived and upon checking out was fortunate enough to meet the real Matilda at reception. A great night stay! An exceptional staff! And love the Marriott is apart of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tobytobytoby188049
Reviews.Content: As a Marriot Platinum member I thought I would try this new autograph hotel. It was absolutely brilliant. Bang in the middle of town - amazing breakfast and restruant - lively bar and full of history and character. Great staff. I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful, unique and authentic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: broadwayfanatic
Reviews.Content: the algonquin is one of the best hotels you will stay at in new york city. It's rooms are very clean and pleasant, and its facilities and lobby are historic and architecturally beautiful. The service is extremely friendly and the location is great! Some of the reviews i read i cannot understand, because it is such a pleasant hotel. Another upside is that it does not have bed bugs (a rarety at this time). The only downside is that shortly after my stay, marriott bought the hotel and has since spiked up the prices of rooms. but, if you are willing to pay an average or slightly higher amount than typical (for a 4 star hotel) for a wonderful nostalgic and very pleasant experience, then the algonquin is the one to go for!

Reviews.Title: “An Olde Jem”
Reviews.Author: Cocobe
Reviews.Content: I won this on PL. Just a marvelous hotel, a lot of love goes into this olde Grand Dame. I really loved the experience. The lobby isn't trendy, it is comfortable and a throw back to a much more elegant time. The lobby is hopping at night, an older refined crowd, very lovely. The rooms are small but it's NYC . They are newly renovated and really comfortable, BEST TV!! The most channels I have seen anywhere better than my cable at home! ( I hate "southern" comcast)... The bathrooms are a hoot...I loved the tub, what a throw back. And the tub stopper is a trip! They did a great job renovating the bathrooms and keeping all the charm. You can turn around and take a few steps in these bathrooms...not like the TRENDY hotel bathrooms. Very clean, which is hard in a hotel this olde. I was in two different rooms, cell phones with AT&T service have issue on the lower floors. My T Mobile phone was fine. The staircase is worth taking the time to appreciate, reminds one of an old boarding house. The marble stairs have worn down over the decades, such history ! The iron railings are gorgeous! I live in a home 20 years younger than the hotel which was built in 1902, so I love this architecture and appreciate the love that is needed to keep things up. I look forward to staying here again. The staff was very nice, the housekeeper I met was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A trip back in time.”
Reviews.Author: mlf4
Reviews.Content: Just finished a one night stay in a suite on the 11th floor. Pros - We found the hotel an excellent stay in a great location in Times Square. The suite was roomy, clean, and well kept. - The hotel lobby is a trip back in time. Cozy and quiet. Lots of tables to hand out and read or have a drink. - The staff was friendly and didn't have any issues. - Parking lot across the street was one of the better I've used in NYC. TIP - don' t bother with valet. The lot is literally across the street. If you have lots of bags, drop them off in front of the hotel then pull into the lot. CONS: - One think the hotel is known for is the $10,000 martini (google it). Getting a drink in the lobby IS expensive. I set a personal record of a drink for spouse and myself for nearly $50 with tip. Ouch. - As an older hotel, it seemed less sound isolated than some of the mega-eye-sore glass towers near by. At night even on 11th floor, street noise was noticeable. All said, I would defiantly consider returning to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the history and service, but rooms not special.”
Reviews.Author: OLBonthego
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night for business on a Priceline special. Hotel has wonderful lobby, friendly service and has a great location. Room and bathroom were small, heater noisy and the walls were a tad thin. Free internet was much appreciated. Hotel had a TV show being filmed in lobby so they offered a free breakfast which was good and a very nice touch. But one small elevator was operating so it did take around 15 minutes to depart. I would have been very unhappy to have spent the normal rate for this hotel, but feel like it was a good value with my deal. But, don't trust Priceline. They rated this hotel as a 4-star while most rate it as a 3-star. As long as you know what to expect and pay accordingly, you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Classy New York”
Reviews.Author: beachloverPrinceton
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Algonquin for 1 night and loved the hotel. The location could not be better and the staff was very attentive, especially as we were travelling with an infant. We were upgraded to a king-size bed room- the room was indeed very small, but impecably clean and functional. The lobby and the bar area are gorgeous- easy to travel back in time and imagine how New York must have been...

Reviews.Title: “Defeciencies Galore”
Reviews.Author: ITREATBACKPAIN
Reviews.Content: I booked my 4 star Midtown hotel in NYC through Priceline and was surprised to have been matched up with the Algoquin as virutally all other online booking agents have them listed as a 3 or 3.5 star hotel. Within moments of my arrival to the hotel, it dawned on me that the Priceline hotel rating was nothing short of a farce. I don't know if the 'old-worlde' look of the property is intentional, and thus, merely trying to recapture its once historical presence, or just a consequence of the owner(s) being too stingy to sink some money into renovations. In any event, with the small, dark lobby, tiny spiral creeky steps down to the outdated bathrooms, and ancient, worn-out mosiac tiling at the entrance to the hotel, I felt utter disappointment at my '4 star' accomodations which only climaxed upon entering my room which was probably less than 100 square feet (not including bathroom) in area. To the hotels credit, the entire room had been recently renovated and was, in and of itself, charming, but nonetheless, difficult to appreciate considering its size. It then became apparent why the hotel clerk that checked me in had indicated that no standard rooms offered two beds--they would not fit. She was, however, able to find me a room with a Queen size bed, rather then Full size, which is what most Standard rooms offer. There is also no pool. The service in the hotel was average at best. While most intereactions I had were positive, on one occasion, I was given attitiude when I could not find something in the hotel. I explcitily asked the hotel staff member, "can you please walk me over to the...I really can't find it". She basically said no, until I begged. I would not return to this hotel in the future for reasons described above. For the traveler that enjoys staying at a historic hotel at the expense of luxury and amenities, I think The Algoquin is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable with excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: On January 22, 2010 my boyfriend and I stayed for 2 nights on a leisure trip to the city. There was a ridiculous cold weather front in the city and the Algonquin was warm and cozy. While the room wasn't extravagant it was spotless and nicely appointed with a comfortable bed, updated flat screen television, and free WI FI. Upon arrival a hotel staff person visited our room to ensure that the heat was working well and the temperature was comfortable. We didn't pay much attention and advised that it was "great!" We left for several hours and returned to find that the temperature had dipped. The front desk immediately sent someone to review that all was working well (the building is quite old so I imagine keeping the old systems in good order can be challenging). The staff person reviewed our heating system, made a quick adjustment and supplied us with complimentary breakfast and cocktail cards and apologized for the inconvenience. We were impressed with the level of service, especially because we confessed that didn't pay close attention when someone visited our room earlier. Service at the front desk, with the bellman, and at the bar was all fantastic. While sitting in the lobby visiting with the hotel's famous cat, Matilda, a staff person went out of the way to bring us drinks and snacks to make us more comfortable. We felt very welcome and enjoyed our stay. I'd recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great History, Mediocre accomodations”
Reviews.Author: louisianamom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for quick weekend trip to visit college kids, but travel twice a month for business, including four or five times per year to NYC (typically staying at a Marriott property due to corporate requirements). Pros: Terrific location in midtown, wonderful bar (home of the Algonquin Round Table), free internet and fascinating history. However, as with many "historic" hotels - and despite its recent renovations - the Algonquin has logistical issues that may or may not be something you are willing to put up with for the interesting past and gorgeous lobby. Spotty service, noisy hallways, creaky floors and rooms tiny even by NYC standards make me reluctant to recommend it. The bathrooms even still look like the early 20th century period from the hotel's early days. A short stay for a good price would make it worth considering - otherwise, go in with lowered expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great new year venue”
Reviews.Author: WendyNorthWest
Reviews.Content: Although our rooms were small and a bit shabby (I think we booked the cheapest as it was New Years Eve) the hotel was ideally situated for New Years Eve celebrations, old world charm abounded and it was pretty good value. Bar was great and we got a good nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Neiman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Algonquin Hotel for four days during the Christmas Holidays. Staying at the Algonquin was like staying at a quaint inn. Since we had tickets to two plays, the location was perfect. The staff was extremely friendly. Our room was small, but the cozy atmosphere of the hotel made up for it. The hotel offers complimentary coffee/tea and a variety of newspapers, which we appreciated. We also enjoyed the presence of Matilda . Although the Algonquin is not the cheapest hotel we have stayed at in NYC, it was well worth the price. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JHH_75
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights at The Algonquin in December and had a suite. So this review might not be applicable for travellers booking standard rooms. Also, I am fully aware that the Algonquin is a very old hotel, so this is also considered in the overall rating. Room: The suite we had was really nice. Small bedroom whith walk-in closet. Nice living room with sofa, two armchairs and desk, two flatscreen TVs. Bathroom is old and small, but OK. The room being at the end of the hallway was quiet. Doors are hardly soundproofed, so everything happening outside can & will be heard. Not a problem in the suite as the sleeping room has a separate door. I would not want to stay in a standard room directly facing the elevators. Overall I was very satisfied with the accomodation. Facilities: Business center (for a fee) and small, but sufficient fitness center (new, free) is available. Free Internet (Wifi and cable) with acceptable speed. Small reception desk, lovely lounge and a separate coctail bar and restaurant. Had breakfast everyday (approx. 25 USD per person). Not cheap, but good. Did only try food at the bar which was good and filling. Service: Alomst all employees I was in contact with were very friendly and helpful, above average. Some extra requests have been fulfilled quickly. Overall: I was staying for Leisure. I doubt that I would choose the hotel on a business trip, as I expect things like quiet rooms, quick check-in/out etc on such trips. Being on vacation, I enjoyed that the overall atmosphere was very calm and did not have issues that things like restaurant service, elevators (2 available) were a little bit slower as elsewhere. In fact, I really appreciated the relaxed atmosphere as this is a nice contrast to the hectic life outside in Midtown. Although being very close to Times Sq, some nice restaurants are in vicinity. Summary: Would I stay again? Absolutely, but not on a business trip and probably not in a standard room. For a vacation in NYC I would book a suite (not a standard room) again without thinking twice, as this hotel provides a non-standard, personalized experience in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, convenient friendly within a few blocks of Grand Central Station and Time Square”
Reviews.Author: emetplay
Reviews.Content: If I had paid attention to the silly negative reviews, we would have missed out on one of the truly wonderful hotel experiences of my long life. While not massive in ANY way, we loved this delightful historic hotel, perfectly located right in the heart of the midtown area, a short walk, even with roller bags, from Grand Central. The staff was warm and friendly and the lobby exudes charm. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet, especially considering the hotel in th heart of the city! The bathroom was small but so is every other one in any of the many NYC hotels I have stayed in. Everything was clean and pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Best starting point to all NY attractions”
Reviews.Author: Waldmeier
Reviews.Content: A very charming hotel at 44th street between 5th and 6th Avenue. With its 12 floors its one of the smaller ones at this place. A great difference to all the large international hotel chains in Manhattan. You will find a family atmosphere and a famous restaurant with superb quality of service and food. According to the age of the hotel rooms are quite small and the bathroom has an old style. But the infrastructure is working without problems. If you are interested in many of the attractions in NYC its not easy to find a better starting point to North, South, East and West. Subway stations are close at Times Square and Byant Park.

Reviews.Title: “Fun to stay in a classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: knitter06
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely night here. While the room and bathroom was small, everything was immaculate and nicely furnished. Staff was friendly and helpful. We had a late night snack in the lobby bar with good food and nice service. The hotel is now part of the Autograph Collection and associated with Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IgorA
Reviews.Content: We did not have high expectations about this hotel but were pleasantly surprised. The room was small but quite comfortable and functional. It looks like the hotel was renovated a year or two ago and the rooms are in very good condition. We did not dine at the hotel restaurant. Wanted to get room service but they have last call at 11 pm, so that was a bummer, especially considering that everything around the hotel is closed after 11 pm. There is a coffee shop accross the street and a diner next door. The hotel also has fabulous location in the theater district between 5th and 6th on 44th St. It was only two blocks from the theatre where Merchant of Venice plays, which we saw) and a few blocks from Times Square. All in all this famous and historic hotel is well worth it if you can get it for a decent price. The staff also talks to you about the history of the hotel and some of the facts are quite interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Red007Toronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for a girls weekend. Hotel was clean and updated somewhat recently. Great location within walking distance to Times Square, subway, restaurants etc. Friendly helpful staff and priceline offered a great deal. Highly reccomend if you want to be in Times Square but stay in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Atmosphere, Great Doorman”
Reviews.Author: CaitlynMC
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Algonquin this past weekend, and we were very impressed upon walking in. Not just because of the historically fascinating and beautifully decorated lobby, but because Peter, one of the doormen, was exceptionally friendly. He smiled and said Hello! as soon as we walked up, and continued to be helpful and friendly for the rest of the weekend. Not only is this abnormal for NYC, I think it's abnormal in general for someone to be so genuinely nice and welcoming. The hotel was great, food was so-so, bed was comfortable but small, and the room was very small (but seemed average for NYC I guess). I'd definitely go back and definitely recommend it to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: Honeyjj
Reviews.Content: Amazing lobby, very grand. Rooms were ok, very small and small beds. Also didn't get much sleep with a loud group next door partying and trying to get through the conjoining door. The manager did go up and sort them out though. Was ok, perhaps i would stay somewhere else next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: rickyfc
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel this is. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. In fact, when I checked in, my room was not quite ready. They offered me drinks on the hotel while I waited. It was only about a 30 minute wait. The room, the 2-room suite, was beyond my expectations, absolutely beautiful and comfortable. If I have the opportunity to get back to NYC, this is definitely the place I'd stay. To top it off, I love that this is a place where Dorothy Parker stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable bathrooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: jgolden2
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel unless location is your main motivation. The bathroom was unacceptable. The sink was rusted, the shower leaked all over the bathroom floor, there was hardly room for one person in the bathroom, the toilet made noises all night and was old and dirty, the hot water in the sink didnt exist. The hot water in the shower was fine. The radiator heat made clanking noises all night. The bed was fine but the other furniture in the room was in not so great condition. The walls were fine and the carpet was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; lots of character, great location and Marriott beds”
Reviews.Author: pennstatetraveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, wonderful staff. Very small lobby, very small rooms but comfortable. Food was good. Location was really great for walking to and from theatre, shopping and dining. An OLD building but in good repair and clean. Resident Cat was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “We were well cared for.”
Reviews.Author: jrowe2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel lobby and lounge, recently refurbished without losing original flavor( they kept the marble steps). Excellent service, friendly and very knowledgeable staff. Great location near Time Square, yet quiet in the evenings, we had no issue with street noise. We will return to this hotel for future New York visits. Say hello to Matilda.

Reviews.Title: “Fine old hotel with a just a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTed
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very old with lots of history - great. There is a cat roaming around and my 1 year old is loving it. The lobby is a fun active place with decent drink service. The hotel rooms are small but my suite had two rooms and was quite comfortable. My parents had a single- very small even for NYC. So - spend the extra $50 and get a suite. The only problem we had was trying to get an air conditioner working - took our entire visit and despite being there in april it got a little warm. They tried to fix it and then gave me a break on the room charge. The location is awesome for shopping, the theatre, and mid-town. I would stay again. My biggest complaint - the slowest and smallest elevators in the world - find the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as i expected”
Reviews.Author: greeny24
Reviews.Content: i used priceline for my trip and when it gave me this hotel i was quite nervous after reading the reviews. what i will agree with is the following: - the size of the room - it way too small for 2 people. one person would either have to sit on the bed while the other person moved around or one person would need to be in the bathroom. - the toilet flushing - quite difficult. i needed to keep my foot on it holding it down strong and it leaked. i'm surprised the hotel did not fix this issue as i read it in another post - it is quite out of date. the wallpaper was peeling from every which way. my take of the room - there was no way to adjust the heat so if i wanted it to cool off i needed to leave the bathroom door open. - the tub/shower drain system - it was different and because the handle was so old it did not stay in place to make sure the drain stayed open. if the shower curtain touched it, it knocked the handle out of place. a bit of an annoyance. - the only noise i heard was the toilet flushing from a neighboring room, but if the bathroom door was closed i could not hear anything. the hotel was sold out during this thanksgiving weekend and i found it to be very quiet. - the bed was extremely soft which i don't like, but others may. - i'm OCD when it comes to cleanliness (oxymoron with hotels) so for the most part it was clean. i absolutely hate finding anyone's hair anywhere and i saw a few in the bathroom. i'm not sure i would stay again, but the priceline amount was extremely reasonable at $150 a block off of times square during thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “WE THOUGHT IT WAS NEW HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: gvagenas
Reviews.Content: Checked in using our rewards points from marriott. Website said "new hotel". At the front desk, I "said is this i new hotel?" , website said it was new, i assumed newly built. But actually new only to Marriott Chain. My wife and I chucked and laughed because we thought we were checking into a "new hotel". But the Front desk informed us it is of "oldest " hotels in new york city. Front desk was prompt. Elevators to fifth floor were great. Room was 500 something, okay size enough for two. Bathroom clean. LOCATION GREAT TO TIMES SQUARE AND OTHER DESTINATIONS, REAL PLUS. Lobby was inviting, cozy with a sense of history. Great deal overall.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one person”
Reviews.Author: nznorm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Algonquin because it is now a Marriott and thy had a good price with extra Marriott points. If you like old historic hotels, then I suppose you would like this one. Not too many hotels have a more storied history. But if you like a nice, big, comfortable room with a great bathroom and views of the city, stay somewhere else. I could not imagine having to share the tiny room with a partner. The rooms are noisy, stuffy and just plain old. And what's the deal with the cat in the lobby? I know it is part of the hotel's history, but it just seemed creepy to me.

Reviews.Title: “WOW so sad!!”
Reviews.Author: anthony6139
Reviews.Content: I went on line to look for a Hotel they said this is a four star hotel I think not. Please don t Vallet your car it took them 1hour and 20 min. to get it and I had to walk down the street to pick it up and pay $55.00 wtf. Mold in the very small bathrooms. Just say NO!

Reviews.Title: “Great Old NYC Hotel, with some quirks”
Reviews.Author: Bennett73
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, a real "Old New York" experience. The rooms, elevators and corridors are all small, but that's pretty normal for a true original NYC building. My room was actually quiet, no real street noise. The room was comfortable, but the bathroom was tiny. This is a really great location if you're doing anything around mid-town/5th Av/Theater District, etc. Everything is walking distance. A few things to note: Their internet service is not compatible with the Chrome browser. This took me a bit to figure out when trying to log on for work so I wanted to help you all out. You need to sign on in an older browser (like Firefox) and then open up Chrome once you are logged in. The service at the front desk could use some work. Give yourself a few extra minutes to do anything there (check in/out, have them hold a bag (or pick it up), etc). No one there is is any real rush to help you so plan ahead and give yourself a few extra minutes if you're going to be rushed. They're usually nice enough, just slow and not in any real hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT reccomend - Marriott should get this out of their collection”
Reviews.Author: DeeGej
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NYC to meet our friends for a fun night out in NYC. Our friends came down from Boston and we came up from Philadelphia. I made the reservations online about 2+ months in advance. I booked the reservation through the Marriott website b/c they were offering a "Re-Opening" special and this hotel was part of their "Autograph Collection". FYI the hotel did not reopen and this place is very old and Marriott needs to take this out of their Autograph Collection immediately!!! (People that stay in Marriotts frequently have certain expectations. This hotel clearly does not meet those of a distiguished traveler) Ok, so despite the efftort to make our reservations in advance, our friends room was not ready until 4:30pm and no consolation was offered to them. Not even a drink at the bar while they waited. Not acceptable when check in is at 3pm. Furthermore, the front desk was rude and unfriendly (typical NYC I guess?). My husband and I had a king suitte. The room was spacious but odd. Two other doors were in our sitting area that led to other guest rooms. I could hear every word that other guests said and I am sure they had to listen to me and my friends until 3am when we got back to our hotel and retired to my sitting area. However, no complaints were lodged. The room was spacious but the bathroom was a closet. The toilets were like subway toilets and were so hard to flush!!!! Everytime we went to the bathroom we spent 5+ minutes trying to get the darn thing to flush. Ridiculous!! And then there was the shower/tub. It was the original from 108 years ago when the hotel opened. Need I say more....GROSS!!!! And only one person could stand in the bathroom at a time bc it was so small. Luckily there was a mirror on the door so my husband could swing it open and get dressed. Finally, when we went to check out and we called down for our car there was a 45 minute wait for the valet. That's ridiculous!! Then they shouldn't offer valet. They should tell you to park across the street and save your $55. I wouldn't reccomend this place to a friend or enemy. Save your money and go somwhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of History and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: belchertownbaby
Reviews.Content: Fine and historic hotel in one of the best locations in the city. Ownership has really done everything to preserve the best of the past. Management really strives to supply the services one would expect today. Great staff. We stayed on the weekend for leisure and would definately stay again. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential NY hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mitsunov
Reviews.Content: Me & my wife love New York deeply. We’ve stayed many kinds of hotel for 25 years. We think The Algonquin hotel is the best in NY! We had been looking forward to this hotel. So after reading some negative reviews on this sight recently, we were afraid of our stay. But in fact our anxiety were dispelled completely. We stayed six nights. First of all we’d like to thank the staffs of this hotel. Bell boy, front staff, concierge, lobby lounge waiter, bartender, clean up staff, etc. Almost of them were kind, friendly, and attentive. And we love the atmosphere of the lobby lounge. It’s classical with just a little orient taste. I was surprised the wall picture. It’s a kind of sepia ink paint. At first we feel something strange. But it matched well with the western décor. And we enjoyed the historical American literature mood. The room was just a little small, but cozy. We suffered from jet lag. Nevertheless, we slept well. The location is great. We can go everywhere easily. Anyway we enjoyed so much and hope to stay at next visit definitely. This is a quintessential New York hotel. We recommend this hotel to genuine NY lovers. You should stay to see Mtilda!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Boutique Hotel with History”
Reviews.Author: garnermurray
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a Holiday Inn, this isn't it. The Algonguin is the longest operating hotel in Manhattan. The rooms & baths are small and not particularly luxurious, beds are comfy- service exceptional. We have stayed in many hotels in Mnahattan- obviously much newer- but none match the service at the Algonquin. Christian, the bartender, was superb as was the concierge. I've seen other negative reviews but those travelers obviously didn't do their homework. Double beds in the longest running hotel in NYC? Go to a chain. Complaints about cocktail pricing? Have you been to Manhattan before? Those expensive cocktails were extremely high quality with fresh ingredients and fresh- squeezed juice when applicable. It is a quirky, historical spot in the very best location with unbelievable service. We just booked our second stay and it's the only place we'll stay from now on. The staff continually asked how they could improve as they were just purchased by Marriott- we responded with mini-bars, upgrade the baths, glam up the room decor (lobby is special)- but you cannot beat the customer service. They made us feel like royalty and that we were home at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “The Algonquin is a historic old hotel...”
Reviews.Author: lorraine6225
Reviews.Content: The Algonquin is a historic old hotel with a lot of charm and hidtory. The building is lovely and the makes you feel like you are stepping back into history. The resident cat is so sweet. But there are some real flaws with this hotel. Service at the front desk was very bad. The room itself was VERY small. The bed is vert comfortable. The bathroom was old and dingy. They need to relace the bathtubs/showrs. There was not enough towels for 2 people. The room had no mini bar and getting ice was difficult. The room has one small bottle of water so you have to go out and get beverages. The TV is great and offers a lot of channels. But overall for what I paid I didn't feel like I was in a luxury hotel and I was disapponted.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the Lobby"”
Reviews.Author: tabarber99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about ambience and location. The lobby is simply gorgeous and the historical literary pedigree of the Algonquin is unsurpassed. Service was great and discreet. As for the rooms, well they are smaller than they appear on the website. Beds are comfy, bathrooms are a big ugh (tiny and in major need of upgrade), but in all honesty I cannot be too harsh bc I was very picky -- I insisted on a King room with a tub, which apparently is problematic. Cool and funky place to stay with excellent location and responsive staff -- at a good pice for midtown -- would definitely return. Also Matlida the cat is a cool customer, and I am not a cat person

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazingly comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: DanithegirlUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last Autumn, but I've only just got around to writing a review. That should be no slur on the hotel at all, its a great place and we got it at a brilliant price through a UK travel agent. Can't comment on the food because we didn't eat there, but there are a plethora of diners and restaurants to eat in around and about. There is a pretty good Indian place just down the street, the food is good, but its a bit pricey. The Red Flame diner next door is ok, I wasn't overly keen, but its cheap and easy enough to get to! Take a wonder off some of the side streets in and around Times Square and you'll find loads of places serving all kinds of food - the fix prix menus are brilliant value. The subway is an easy walk from the hotel in Times Square and you really can't beat this hotel for location. As for the hotel itself, we found the staff helpful and friendly, the room was always clean and tidy and we had no problem with the size of our room or bathroom. Yes its not massive, but you're in a hotel in a city and its way better than you'd get in London or any other European city for the price! If I had to say one thing that was slightly annoying, there are only 2 lifts, so occasionally you'd have to wait. That said, we spent 5 nights here and it was never an issue. All in all, the Algonquin gets 2 thumbs up from us!

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MrMcBride
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Wife had booked to stay in the Algonquin Hotel in September for 4 nights. On our arrival we were informed by the font desk that we were double booked and would be moved to another hotel for the first 2 nights. As we had booked 11 months in advance we were not impressed and thought it was abit of a joke for the hotel to do this. I think treating your paying customers like this reflects very bably on the hotels reputation. Luckily the hotel we were moved to was only the next block (Hotel Mela). As far as I'm concerned we should never of been moved as we had booked well in advance and this really annoyed the both of us. After the 2nd night we moved back to the Algonquin and were given a room upgrade but to be honest I would of rather stayed in the Hotel mela which we found was more to our taste and nearer Times Square. Even though we preferred the other hotel we booked 4 nights at the Algonquin and expected that to be honoured. I have since found out that we were lucky not to be moved miles away to another hotel. We won't book this hotel again as we couldn't be certain where we were going to be staying. I will go back to Hotel Mela, we found their staff very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: m2ice
Reviews.Content: Got the Algonquin on a Priceline bid for a Sat. and Sun. at the end of Sept. for $160/nt. Had back up reservations in NJ at the same rate and at a 2* in the Times Square area at 100/ nt more so was very happy with the price. After reading the reviews I had mixed feelings. As it turned out good reviews were the right ones. The hotel is old but well maintain, the employees (with the except on one front desk clerk who was just o.k.) were great and the location can't be beat. I requested a room with lots of natural light and was given a street view room with two windows on the 5th floor. Slept with the window cracked and there was not enough noise to bother us. It had a small walk in closet and while the room was not large it was not what I would call small either. Would I pay $400/nt for this hotel? No, but guess what, there isn't any hotel room that I would. Positives Location-Great Bedding-Great Employees-For the most part very good. Parking-Very good Room service-all we got was ice-very fast and friendly Free internet-Great. Nothing burns me more then paying 100+ a night and then getting charged for internet. Average- Public areas are small and fairly dark. My Girlfriend loved it, and I didn't dislike it. Notes, I travel with cheap luggage, a cooler of drinks and a couple of canvas totes, Not exactly high style. At no time did I feel that we were treated any less then the best. In fact the door/bell men were great with loading and unloading the car. storing luggage and even got ice for the cooler when we departed. This hotel is not for everyone, but if you like a little history, great location and good service I don't think you will be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PaulS40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Algonquin for one night. The location was perfect; walking distance to dinner and a Broadway show. We drove into the city without hassle and parked directly across from the hotel ($35 overnight for hotel guests). I made the mistake of leaving my camera, cell phone and I-pod in the car when it was parked but all were still there when we checked out the next morning! Hotel staff was courteous and stored our bags until check-in. The room was small, as was expected. Comfy bed and bedding, hot shower, flat screen TV, New Yorker and an apple; just as advertised. A little bit noisey being at the front of the hotel but not a big problem. Being forwarned by other reviewers we did not have a drink in the lobby/lounge (although it was a charming and comfy place to sit) or breakfast at the hotel. Breakfast next door was quick, hot and inexspensive ($12 for two). The front desk was in "training mode" with new personnel and all were friendly and helpful. This is a great location if you need to be in the Theater District. Eat and drink elsewhere and park across the street. Still expensive but not budget breaking.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Algonquin......I had a nice day!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chuckles13
Reviews.Content: Now i'm not an experienced traveller, or am I used to staying in top notch hotels, but I really couldn't think of anything to complain about at the Algonquin! Part of staying in other countries is about experiencing their culture, quirks, and personalities, and found the staff helpful, funny, cheerful and a pleasure to talk to. The room was always clean, had a fab hot shower, large TV, and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! It was small, but quite frankly for the amount of time we actually spent in it, it really didn't matter! The air con was noisy, but if we left it on while we were out it stayed cool overnight, so we could turn it off. The hum of the city was also loud, but by the time I fell into bed I slept like a log. The hotel was gorgeous, with a unique atmosphere and a welcome change of scene from the buzz and bright lights of the rest of New York City, and its individuality sets it apart from the other glossy, clinical, modern hotels that all look and feel the same. I can honestly say that the Algonquin contributed to making my trip to New York, as rich, diverse, and fulfilling as I could have hoped for!

Reviews.Title: “Stuck-up has-been”
Reviews.Author: RochdaleMasher
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, undersized and far too impressed with it's own history. We found the staff to be patronising and aloof. The room tiny (even by NY standards).Only refuge was the bar. Stay away. You can get a lot better for your dollar. If you do visit the bar, make sure you pop across the road to The Royalton - probably the sexyest lobby in NY city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely visit at a literary landmark”
Reviews.Author: 2CountryWalkers
Reviews.Content: We booked a premier suite for three of us: my husband, our 20 year old daughter, and me. We made our reservation through the Algonquin website and got one of their special rates (Writer's Block). I was concerned by the negative reviews I saw here on Tripadvisor, but we had a wonderful visit with none of the problems mentioned by other reviewers. The hotel is beautiful and historic, yet well maintained and current, with free wireless internet access in the room. The staff at the front desk was friendly, helpful and efficient, as were the bellmen. We arrived around 1 p.m. and our suite was ready for early check-in, even though we hadn't pre-arranged an early arrival. The Al Hirschfeld suite was lovely and very clean. The roomy living area was beautifully decorated and overlooked 44th street. The sofa bed was already made up with crisp, clean linens. The hotel's proximity to Times Square allowed us to take a quick after-dinner trip out to enjoy the late night buzz, and then stroll home for a good night's sleep. Our king-size bed was firm and comfy. We heard no traffic noise in either sleeping area. We ate breakfast at the diner next door to the hotel. Breakfast for three was about $25. Our train wasn't leaving until 9 p.m. so we asked if the hotel could store our luggage plus an odd-shaped piece of artwork we'd purchased. They were very accommodating and stored our luggage until we picked it up that evening. Since the hotel is only 10 blocks from Penn Station, this was very convenient. All in all, it was a wonderful visit. We would definitely stay at the Algonquin again.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off Merchants!”
Reviews.Author: Suz73
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was very rude for a start, acting like we were an inconvenience. Then we made the mistake of using the hotel phone to make a 35 minute call to the UK. The phone didn't seem to work or accept coins when an operator came on the line asking if I needed assistance. I said yes and gave her the number, she then connected me. However no cost or rate was mentioned. Later on my parents received a bill for 300 dollars! For a 35 minute call, that is daylight robbery. They complained to the hotel which dismissed the complaint saying that the phones are there for the convenience of guests and they don't operate them! They said complain to the phone co. Some convenience, and who gives that phone co. permission to put there phones in there? Total scam, don't be had. Would never go back. I wonder how many of these good reviewers got a shocker of a phone bill a month or 2 after they did their review!

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk a Horror Show; hotel excellent; wait for specials”
Reviews.Author: natsmom229
Reviews.Content: Like some of the other recent travelers who have posted about their experiences at the Algonquin, I have to agree that the women at the front desk (one in particular) seemed bored with me and openly hostile when asked when she thought our room might be ready. The doormen were great; the bartender fine. Rooms are small, but so is this lovely old hotel that is a lot of fun. I hope the management will work with the front desk staff on manners. PS: The Algonquin occasionally has special rates, esp. during slow times. Get on their email list. Our room was only $134.00 per night when pre-booked. Usually, the room is almost $300.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nicci15
Reviews.Content: I really can't review the hotel itself...because I never got past the lobby. After making a reservation through Travelocity a month prior to my arrival, I walked in the Algonquin only to be greeted by a smiling desk clerk happily telling me that we had no room as construction was taking place! Yeah that's news that will make me happy - Not! As I was traveling halfway across the cournty, I would have appreciated a call to warn me and allow me to cancel. The air-headed desk clerks told me that they had made a reservation for me at a hotel that was about three miles away....not exactly near Times Square which was the area I had hoped to stay in. She told me that there was no other hotel anywhere in the area with open rooms so I could either go to the other hotel or be refunded my money. Yeah that really helps when you just flew in, had no place to stay and would have to pay more than $800 for a new flight home! (I did move to the other hotel which turned out to be much nicer than the Algonquin. But guess what, the Algonquin people incorrectly booked me for three nights rather than four, still leaving me to clear up their mistakes!) I was absolutely enraged. Never once did I receive an apology for their error and I was not even allowed to speak to a manager. Let's be honest, the most likely explanation was that someone came to the hotel that day and was willing to pay a higher rate than my pre-paid and confirmed reservation rate. This place may be the nicest hotel in the world, and the people in the lobby lounge were trying hard to make things better for us, but the hotel desk staff is inept and have a lot to learn about treating people well. I wouldn't stay in this hotel if it were free! Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Oh what's happened to our beloved Algonquin?”
Reviews.Author: Muddahof03
Reviews.Content: We are an active elderly mother/daughter traveling team who love old quirky hotels. When we visit Manhattan we most often stay at the Algonquin. Over the years we enjoyed the Algonquin for birthday celebrations, family Christmas reunions, visits with faraway friends. The hotel was the ideal rendezvous point -- a lovely lobby, quirky rooms, excellent martinis, perfect location, and once (note ONCE) awesome staff always made our stays memorable. But that all ended with our last two visits. We dismissed our unpleasant stay in March as an aberration which started with lost online reservation made through the hotel web site and an incompetent desk staff. Then a rollaway jammed into our room so my 84-year-old mother had to practically climb over beds to get to the bathroom. To make up for the trouble we were given a complimentary breakfast that made highway rest stop food seem gourmet. How could this be the Algonquin we've come to love? This had to be a fluke. So, we reserved a room for July 21, one of the hottest days on record. The door staff was unresponsive to my old Mom exiting our cab with a carry-on bag in her hand. The front desk staff was no more competent than our last visit and certainly surly. When we learned our early check in room was not ready, we were admonished that they were "very busy." Finding a little table in the lobby we could do nothing but wait. Mom wanted a drink. The lobby wait staff fell over each other, yet our order of a cheese plate took nearly an hour to arrive. Finally making it to the room we discovered an amusing little card on our nightstand that read in part "In the city that never sleeps, Matilda (the resident cat) thinks these may help you" and were directed to the ear plugs in the drawer. We enjoy city noise and have never had a problem sleeping with it humming in the background. But we soon learned that the room's AC system was so loud it justified Matilda's gift! Turn it off and you can't breathe. Turn it on and you can't sleep. What has happened to our beloved Algonquin? No greetings made, no assistance offered, no goodbyes, no more will we stay at the Algonquin. We will miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out!”
Reviews.Author: Hiccupx03
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel using Priceline.com. Our reservation was for two double beds. We were given a room with two twin beds and told the hotel does not have any rooms with two double beds. We were then forced to use a room with a king size bed and share. The bed was a bit lumpy, room was warm and very small. If we had been in Europe, would have understood the smallness of the room. The bathroom was old, not maintained as well as they should be for the price (dirty tiles in the shower & leaky shower head). The carpet had a slimy feel to it...not sure if it was from the heat/humidty but it just felt dirty. Hotel is trying to be elegant but still lacking beyond the 1st floor. The one saving point for our stay at the hotel was the bell hops, bar ender and doormen. Professional! The woman working the front desk could use a bit of mentoring from them.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel excels during heat wave”
Reviews.Author: BPTO
Reviews.Content: During my recent six-night stay in early July, the temperature in Manhattan spiked at 105 degrees Fahrenheit plus humidity. Given that this hotel is more than a century old, I was surprised and delighted to discover that the air conditioning was up to the task and my room was a cool oasis in the midtown heat. I have stayed at the Algonquin before and, once again, the staff were great and the ambience was terrific. Modest sized rooms, slightly creaky elevator, decor a little worn in places -- but this classic hotel delivered exactly what I needed and did it superbly. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about how wonderful our stay was at the Algonquin!”
Reviews.Author: Jess8708
Reviews.Content: I have never been to a hotel, especially in New York, where the staff was as incredible as the ones at the Algonquin. From the moment we arrived they went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. The bellmen were wonderful (especially David and Sean)! We were traveling with our two small children and I was very impressed that, given the large number of guests they accommodate, they remembered our children and greeted them by name. In an attempt to not disturb other hotel guests with a crying baby in the middle of the night we took a walk to the lobby where we met Matilda and another incredible hotel employee (regretfully I did not get his name). This gentleman even performed a juggling act for my son in an effort to console him at 3am! Where else can you stay and get that kind of personal service! The hotel was very quiet and clean and the location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “I normally  don't write bad reviews but...”
Reviews.Author: Ericrasm
Reviews.Content: I normally  don't write bad reviews but this one i was so compelled to do so from this experience with this hotel. We ordered a room through priceline. We called to reserve a double bed, which they failed to tell us can only be 2 twin beds and costs $60 extra dollars!  Its already overpriced as it is.  The hostess was rather stupid and rude and just kept throwing out the word boutique as if it would make everything acceptable.  The room was extremely small and the bath tub is so high it's asking for a lawsuit from someone slipping. Water temp kept going hot then cold. The only thing that was good about this 'boutique' was the location.  I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay warm and charming”
Reviews.Author: sabrinaSeaford
Reviews.Content: I got back today from a two night stay at the Algonquin. When you walk into the lobby you're taken back into a different era, the lobby is beautifully decorated, very warm and inviting.You are greeted by a staff that is friendly and polite I live on Long Island and it's nice to see people at work who enjoy their jobs. And then, there is Matilda the cat, she too is very friendly roaming around the lobby watching everyone come and go. The rooms are spacious enough for two adults, the bathroom is newly renovated .I would recommend this hotel IT was a very pleasing and relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: superstar4772
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old. Very historic. We had the New Yorker Suite. So it consisted of a nice sized room with a couch and pull out bed. Nice flatscreen TV. As well, a separate bedroom with king size bed. Only 1 bathroom with the classic soaker tub and sink. Room was overall very clean as well as the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Just steps away from Times Square. It definitely isn't your typical modern day hotel with the amenities like a pool, etc. This hotel really lets you enjoy the classic moments of living in NYC. You can get a nice, modern hotel room for the same cost however, this place is smaller in size and everyone is friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a chubby cat”
Reviews.Author: BON3S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice the corridors were particularly cold - i think the cat is fat to stop the frostbite in some sections. The hotel rooms were nice not the smallest that I've been in but also not the biggest. The only downside was the shower you had to wait 15minutes under the water before you could entered because it was so cold. The service was great both reception and concierge are very happy to help

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel should be condemned.”
Reviews.Author: WriterAndAuthor
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Algonquin for 36 years interspersed with stays at other hotels, particularly the Sofitel a few doors away. The restaurant is a nightmare, the food ordinary or worse and the "newly renovated" rooms below any standard with the possible exception of backwater villages deep in South America. We are charmed and attracted by the New Yorker and Algonquin Round Table legends and we wish we could own Matilda. But we will never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, loads of character but our bedroom was poor”
Reviews.Author: CheshireKats
Reviews.Content: After two weeks' travelling the USA we thought we'd treat ourselves to something special on our last night and we did just that at the Algonquin. After the shock at the size of the room (I actually rang down to check we hadn't accidentally been put in a single room) we really settled into the quirky character of the place. We did have cocktails and dinner and enjoyed a completely different evening to the typical US hotel experience. It was almost British....waiters very restrained, service leisurely and clientele interesting to say the least plus magnificent public rooms. For the money our bedroom was poor, very small, no outlook, noisy due to other a/c units. However, we'd recommend it if you want to stay somewhere different and have ample cash as it has a real feeling of New York's history. PS. As cat lovers it was a bonus to be greeted by Matilda

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: gmcc
Reviews.Content: I know this is an old hotel but the room was tiny. i don't think i have stayed in a smaller room. My first thought when I saw the bed was that we were in a single room (Room 715). The bed was comfy but too small for comfort. The room was at the back of the hotel so no noise- a good plus point. The bathroom was ok but as someone previously commented the bath was very high and my wife had a bit of a problem getting in and out due to the height. Location good for Times Square and Grand Central Station. We didn't eat in the hotel. There is a diner next door and a coffee shop across the road. Both were fine for breakfast. The Blue bar was dear ($18 for a gin and tonic) but on our last night we were given the drinks on the house That was a nice touch. the barman was very helpful and made some recommendations for eating in different areas of the city. While the hotel has a goon name I dont think I would rush back to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms are nice.”
Reviews.Author: lbischof
Reviews.Content: We stayed in NYC for one night to see a show and we were able to get a great price via Priceline.com. Originally, we were assigned a full bed. The concierge upgraded us to a King bed in a newly renovated room. The older hotels in NYC tend to have smaller rooms, however, the friendliness of the staff, and cleanliness of the room, made up for the size. The new beds are VERY comfortable! This was a very nice experience and location is excellent. By the way, we loved the hotel cat, Matilda!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vancuver
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Algonquin on Saturday, May 15th early in the morning. We called ahead to confirm a cot for my teenage daughter with reservations. When we arrived, the front desk had no information about our request. We had to wait an hour to talk to the manager. The manager did accomodate us but the reservation clerk was abrupt and rude. She did tell us that a room that night would cost $779. She knew that we booked through priceline.com. The room was small and the bathroom was so tiny that it was almost difficult to close the door. The bathtub was so high it was dangerous to get in and out of without assistance. The biggest problem with the hotel was the lack of hot water. We were not able to shower for the first 36 hours because there was a problem with the hot water tank. Even when it was fixed, we had to let the shower warm-up for 15 minutes. When it finally warmed up, then the steam from the bathroom caused the fire alarm to go off. It then took another 5-10 minutes it to turn off. Bottom line: We were very dissatisfied with the hotel. We stayed at the Sofitel for a week in March. We would highly recommend the Sofitel - same block, beautiful rooms and bathrooms and great service.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced for a supposedly superior room”
Reviews.Author: tessyScotland
Reviews.Content: bed great. tiny bathroom but was clean enough. definitely not the superior room my mum had paid for the both of us.almost charged twice to ensure it was twin beds. dont use hotel phone, cost $150 for 4 phone calls back to uk. when bell man took cases up to room didnt have any change to tip him, thought we would tip him when we saw him later, he was very ignorant, totally blanked us, only spoke when we had asked him about something. breakfast way out of our price range for the simplest of things. would not go back there

Reviews.Title: “Reminded me of hotels in Ireland.”
Reviews.Author: TheDebster1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a weekend here recently, to take in a Broadway play and play tourists. We thought the hotel and staff were very welcoming and friendly. This hotel is very old and quaint, but has been maintained very well. I spent 3 weeks in Ireland and traveled around the entire country and stayed in lots of different hotels. The Algonquin reminded me of those Irish hotels. Dark wood paneling, long winding halls, very tiny rooms. Our room was very very small, and a very tiny bathroom. I was struck by how comfy the bathroom actually was considering it's size. They did a really nice job of updating it. Our room had a King size bed, a small desk and two very small night tables. You had just enough room to walk by the bed to get to the bathroom. Very small, but the bedding was comfortable. We were on the 4th floor and it was very quiet. Never heard any noise except people slamming their doors. The doors are kind of heavy and have a tendency to slam on their own. We ate a dinner and a breakfast in the dining room. We expected to have a complimentary breakfast, but it didn't seem to be available when we were there. The food was delicious, if not pricey. I would definitely stay here again. It was very close to Times Square and Broadway. Sean would fetch us a taxi. Very handsome young man. ;-) Also, there is a very good coffee and pastry shop directly across the street. Very yummy pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, People. Quit Complaining!”
Reviews.Author: kartwoman
Reviews.Content: If you are going to flip out because your television and internet don't work fast enough, then don't even think about it. If little quirks and well-worn furnishings repel you, look elsewhere. If you don't get a decent deal, say, under $325, you might want to think twice. But I thoroughly enjoyed my time at the Algonquin. I loved sitting in the lobby with my book, soaking in the history and watching Matilda run around. Also appreciated the flurry of characters coming and going - really a kick. The food and wine choices were kind of lame and my bathtub refused to drain (which really was rather gross), but, personally, I ate it all up. The Algonquin felt like a safe and welcoming cocoon - I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New York Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kartvelebi
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about my stay here. I expected a smaller room, as is the norm in NYC. Some historic hotels are in awful shape and quite dirty, the Algonquin was not in this category -- it was in excellent condition and I found it to be very charming and a delight. In fact, its decades-old bathroom was in better condition than some hotels built ten years ago. Yes, you might lose patience with the speed of the elevator, but that's all part of the charm of staying at a small, older hotel. The location was quite good for a variety of tourist destinations. The free high-speed internet was quite good. Watch out for the doormen, they're quite slick. Also, beware of taxi drivers at this stop, they tried hitting the 2x meter rate and I had to argue with them to do the right thing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Algonquin”
Reviews.Author: LaDonnaRae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Algonquin for 4 nights during the first of April. The place was lovely. The lobby is particularly lovely with an old fashioned ambience to it. The bar is classic looking and the people were all very friendly and helpful. The location is ideal for walking to nearby Broadway and Times Square. Our room was unfortunately on the 3rd floor and every night sometime between 2 and 4am I was awakened to hearing street noise that sounded like a dump truck loading bottles of glass. When we go back we'll request a room higher up to avoid that minor inconvenience. My husband never heard it so if you're a sound sleeper then no worries. One more unique thing about the Algonquin, it has a cat, Matilda, who lives in the lobby. She is beautiful and fits nicely into the atmosphere of this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: gmanOhio
Reviews.Content: No better service have I receieved in such of a fine Hotel. Arrived in blue jeans and was treated 1st class. No snobby stuff . Partner had a broken ankle and the staff went all out too accommodate us. One of New York's finest.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location,perfect base.”
Reviews.Author: HappygalS_E_Ireland
Reviews.Content: First trip to New York and couldn't have chosen a better location. It was really central , just a stone's throw from Times Square.We didn't spend too much time in the hotel as New York had so much to offer but enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere there in the evenings ,after a hectic day.Yes the room was tiny, the hotel is old and my first impression was "Yikes it's so dark" when you go in in daytime. However it was really genteel, the staff were AMAZINGLY ATTENTIVE. We found the lounge food a little stodgy and the restaurant food quite rich ,but enjoyed breakfast and some meals in the really popular diner right next door. Our room was pretty small but good closet and functional ,if old bathroom,larger than expected. No fan or opening window in the bathroom , which was a nuisance when showering.We would recommend the hotel, a tad quirky but very peaceful and very quiet for sleeping. We had no view but didn't care, saw plenty instead all day.don't really think children would be too impressed however,despite large tv and dozens of channels.Great for couples who just need a base for an action packed trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, old world hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ingrid45
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 5 night stay in the Algonquin hotel in New York. Firstly the bedrooms ARE small, but dont let that put you off. We had a walk in closet, a reasonably sized bathroom ( could have done with better quality towels) with ample space to put our stuff. The bed was immensely comfortable and the room was very clean. Our rate included continental breakfast which was really nice and more than adequete. The lobby area is wonderful, full of standard lamps, cosy nooks and sofas and armchairs, very old world and charming. Drinks are expensive there, 15 dollars before tax and tip for a vodka, though the measures seemed to be generous. Mathilda the cat was on hand greeting everyone, very sweet. We attended the show in the Oak Room on the Saturday night. We paid 360 dollars for two of us, this included dinner, one bottle of wine, the show and a tip. Certainly it was expensive but the show with Mark Nadler and KT Sullivan was wonderful and it was a nice opportunity to get all dressed up. Overall, the staff were most pleasant and attentive and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and well located BUT old and stuffy.”
Reviews.Author: SuitNflipflops
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because we managed to score a really great rate for the room. The price and the hotel's central location was the best part of my stay. Hotel and the rooms were clean and comfortable, decorated in a somewhat stuffy manner that I don't particularly care for but has nothing really wrong with it. Feng Shui is not for everyone after all. Beware of the elevators in you're in rush - they are slowwwwwww. Room were tiny even by New York standards. Moreover, the TV was the size of a computer screen and my window looked directly out to a wall. Seriously, I opened the blinds and got a brick wall instead. Good part of a wall though is that the room was quiet. Finally, I had brunch at the restaurant which was small but good (and as you won't be surprised to read, was in a room with no windows). Only downer there was that whatever money I saved on the room, I wasted on paying for my meal but, hey, it's New York after all...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: FsuTraveler
Reviews.Content: The algonquin hotel is a historic hotel just blocks from times square. My room was very small (a queen bed, with little space around it), but I was traveling alone so it was enough room for me. The view was dissapointing considering I was facing an alley way, but besides that I had a great experience at this hotel. The queen bed was extremely comfortable, and the HD LCD TV was a nice plus. The bathroom had amazing water pressure (one of the best I've ever experienced at a hotel). The room was nice and clean, and even though it was small it had great quality. The room service, and housekeeping was very fast and efficient, and I never had problems with noise from outside or other rooms. The lobby is really cool and historic and the bar connected to the hotel is nice (kinda expensive). Overall I would recommend the Algonquin Hotel, try to get a room with a view, and if you are traveling with a friend or spouse, try to upgrade from the queen size bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “great service location and busy lobby”
Reviews.Author: judi2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last weekend. We truly enjoyed the hotel. They were having very bad weather and we had booked the night club show. It was a lot of fun and the food was surprisingly good. This is not a hotel for young people. The lobby is always busy with people being served drinks. The only complaint I have is that I had to ask for robes and a top sheet and my sheets kept coming off the bed. For the money we paid, including continental breakfast, it was great. Our room was not that small and the bathroom was large compared to some other hotels. they don't have valet parking because the garage is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel - does just enough to be AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: skanklor
Reviews.Content: Not really sure what the hoopla is about this hotel. It is really old- which is fine- but when an old heater keeps rattling during the night and keeps you up, then that is a problem. i complained to the desk, but their "technician" said that it was steam going through the pipes and that it shld stop once the room reaches a certain temperature. Well, I have news for you, it didn't stop rattling that night. To the front desk's credit, they offered to move us to another room, but we declined when the heater stopped making any noise during the day.
